Title: Machine Learning Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
We are Kineo, a Berlin-based tech startup developing machine learning solutions that bring real, tangible business value to our clients. Through our expertise, mindset, culture and most importantly with your help we are turning the AI landscape upside down. Are you excited to contribute to meaningful, impactful projects?




Our proposition to you





We vouch to create a space where you can explore different sets of complex problems and data across industries and verticals.


To support you in your personal development, everyone at Kineo has a mentor. When you grow, so does Kineo.


Your decisions matter! You will not have a boss who decides things for you. At Kineo we believe that decisions are best made locally, by the people closest to the problem at hand.


Transparent salary and career planning from day one.


A beautiful office in the centre of Kreuzberg, with tons of benefits, such as free drinks, snacks, consoles etc.


28 days of vacation


A shared revenue model - when Kineo does well, you will benefit financially, too





Success in the role means that you will have





After 2 months: You established yourself as a member of the team and have already contributed to one of our client projects. You have a clear understanding of how we work and can independently navigate our technical architecture.


After 6 months: You are a key member of the team and fully involved in the development of a client project. You will have made notable contributions to our codebase and internal processes.


After 12-24 months: In collaboration with internal science and engineering resources, you lead the development of a client-facing application from the workshop phase to production. You are a trusted expert in a wide variety of machine learning algorithms and you are able to transfer that knowledge to more junior members of the team.





Your Character Traits





You want to achieve something and don't need a "manager" to tell you that. You are eager to have space to take responsibility and grow from that.


You enjoy exploring beyond your immediate tasks and are open to learning new skills. You collaborate across different areas to help the team succeed, even in areas outside your main expertise.


You are a strong communicator with the ability to present ideas clearly and collaborate effectively. You value building positive relationships and working together to achieve shared goals.





You fit in with our team culture if you





Enjoy working in an environment that combines pragmatic, commercial thinking with a strong desire to learn and grow together. We value team players that are curious but convey humility and respect for different opinions.


You actively choose to work in a start-up, with all the ups and downs.


See open feedback, accountability and independent thinking as the foundation for exceptional (team) work.


You embrace Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. You are excited to contribute to an environment where different perspectives are celebrated, and you actively participate in fostering awareness and continuous learning around DEI.



Tasks



You will work as part of smaller teams of 2-3 people on developing machine learning solutions with our clients.


You will conceptualize and implement algorithmic solutions to challenging business problems. This includes prototyping and productionizing of machine learning solutions, and also defining and analysing product use cases together with the customer.


You will own machine learning solutions from the first drop of raw data, all the way into production serving millions of inference requests.



Requirements



An advanced quantitative degree - e.g Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related fields. Strong knowledge of theoretical math and CS.


At least two years of work experience as Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.


Knowledge of working with large structured and unstructured data sets. Knowledge of data engineering tools like Apache Spark is an advantage.


Strong programming skills in Python. We love other languages too, but Python is what we (and you) will use.


We are AI Consultants - ask yourself: Do you want to be a Consultant?


Experience in using a wide range of ML frameworks such as SKLearn, Tensorflow, Torch in production. Experience with domain specific libraries like OpenCV, HuggingFace etc are an advantage.


Good written and verbal communication in both English and German. Most of our clients are German speaking so a level of at least B2 is required for the role.


Resident in Germany. Due to the size of the company, we cannot currently accept applications from other EU/non-EU countries.





We explicitly do not hire anyone who discriminates against people on the basis of religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status or other aspects. We encourage people from LGBTQIA+ and other underrepresented groups to apply.




Last but not least, keep in mind that we are hiring value based, not skill based. That being said, please tell us the following in your contact message:





Why we would love to work with you


Why you want to work with us
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent employee, Full-time


Berlin


Your Responsibilities


Data Processing & Curation – You engage with our internal and public data to create clean datasets as a basis for our energetic simulations
Algorithm Development – You develop and tune Algorithms that enhance the quality and efficiency of the energy consultation for our customers
Benchmarking – You assess the performance of your algorithms, ensuring they meet our high-quality standards
New Approaches – You keep an eye on the latest developments in AI and come up with new approaches to improve our data products


Your profile


Studies & Professional Experience – You possess a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, or a related field, complemented by a robust professional track record in data science, with at least 3 years in a Data Science role
Technical Expertise – You have excellent Python skills and understanding of common machine learning algorithms, cloud computing and data science software stack
Ingenuity – You are a creative and innovative problem solver who loves to overcome challenges
Mindset & Collaboration – You're self-organised and thrive working independently, yet are eager to collaborate with everyone. With a 'maker' mindset, you're conceptually adept and shine through your proactive and confident approach


Fuchs & Eule


We take our responsibility for a green future seriously and aim to make a significant contribution to CO2 reduction through our commitment to energy efficiency.
We are ambitious and constantly strive to improve. That’s why we give people the space to grow and take responsibility, and the support they need.
We are digital, innovative, customer focused and highly motivated to achieve great things with you.
We are a real team and support each other, speak our minds, have fun together and have a genuine desire to make a positive difference.
We understand the importance of in-person interactions versus virtual ones, which is why we have thoughtfully designed our office in Berlin and focus on team events. At the same time, we place a high value on flexibility, allowing our team to work from home two days a week.


Apply for this job

About Us

Now is the time to take action and fight the climate crisis. We want to support as many homeowners as possible to make their homes energy efficient and receive the best possible funding.

Residential homes are responsible for a significant percentage of global CO2 emissions and the pressure from high energy costs is higher than ever, but the path to a climate-neutral home with optimal funding is complicated. We combine expertise in the energy and buildings sector with practical project support and digital innovation, helping people and the environment in equal measures.

Apply for this job

We look forward to receiving your convincing application!

We are excited about your interest in Valyria. Please fill out the following short form.

Data privacy statement

Uploading document. Please wait.

Please add all mandatory information with a * to send your application.

Title: Data Scientist in Energy Tech Start Up - hybrid Berlin based (f/m/d)
Description:
Digitalization and energy transition in one sentence? That’s what we do at Green Fusion! Our software optimizes heating systems in the real estate sector, helping to combat climate change through digitalization and automation. We reduce emissions and energy consumption, actively advancing the energy transition.




As a Data Scientist, you’ll support our Energy Optimization Team by developing production-ready algorithms that optimize heating system operations. With a basic understanding of heating systems and strong expertise in control technology, you’ll bring essential insights to help us develop effective tools for energy optimization.


Tasks



Data Analysis: Clean and analyze data to identify patterns and trends, uncovering insights that drive our solutions.


Statistical Analysis: Use statistical techniques to interpret data, ensuring the reliability and accuracy of your findings.


Data Science: Create data models to predict heating system behavior and patterns using advanced analytics techniques and machine learning.


Algorithm Development: Create production-ready algorithms and data pipelines to optimize energy system components, reducing CO2 emissions and enhancing energy efficiency.


Collaboration: You will be responsible for the entire process of developing product features, from understanding customer requirements to final feature deployment. This requires seamless collaboration with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, product and customer success managers.


Research Support: Conduct experimental data analysis to refine and improve energy optimization algorithms.


Clear Communication: Present findings in a concise and understandable manner.


Additional tasks: Support our team in creating data models to predict energy time series data (e.g. heat demand, solar production, electricity consumption) and in optimizing energy systems using machine learning algorithms ((Un)supervised and Reinforcement Learning).



Requirements



Location: You are living in Berlin.





Experience





At least three years of professional experience in data science. Familiar with product lifecycles (Feasibility studies, requirement engineering, production-ready tool development, code reviews, feature deployments, continuous maintenance and improvement).





Must haves





Strong skills in statistics, data modeling, data analysis and machine learning.


Educational background in: electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics or computer science, data science, mathematics with a strong background in energy tech.





Technical Knowledge





Expertise in developing prediction models and working with energy time series data.


Proficient in Python, SQL, GraphQL, REST, and data science libraries like Pandas, SciPy, and Scikit-Learn. Machine Learning Operations skills are a plus.


Hands-on experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative coding practices.






Testing: Familiarity with testing frameworks and quality assurance practices to ensure robust and reliable product features.


Programming Style: Your code is clean, well-structured, maintainable, and easy to understand for team collaboration.


Communication: You are comfortable collaborating and communicating effectively with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, and customer success managers.


Customer Focus: A strong understanding of customer needs and how they translate into technical solutions.


Language Skills: Fluent in English, with basic German.



Benefits


🏠 Flexible working hour models, home office, and remote work.




💡 Ongoing training opportunities – whether through job challenges, our open feedback culture, or sponsored training programs, there are always opportunities to learn and grow.




💼 Employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.




🌱 Direct impact through your job – with us, you can actively contribute to the energy transition and fight against climate change every day.




💚 We value our team – that's why regular team events are very important to us.




🙌 The best team that Berlin has to offer – and maybe even beyond. Don’t believe it? Then find out for yourself and apply now!




---




While we are still considered pioneers today, we can soon dominate the market with you! First in the DACH region, then throughout Europe.




You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment that is passionate and ambitious about actively shaping the energy transition – a goal that can only be achieved together!




We look forward to your application – Fernanda will get in touch with you!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That’s where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Data Scientist (d/f/m) at Aignostics, you work on interdisciplinary projects to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. Together with your colleagues you apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve complex real-world problems. You independently conduct rigorous experiments while also contributing well-designed features to our codebase.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ data scientists, software developers, biologists, and pathologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take responsibility and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Work on interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Apply and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Clearly communicate your results


What We Are Looking For


Degree in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and 1-2 years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Experience with development of deep learning models for computer vision
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Excellent communication and team working skills


Bonus points for


Exposure to biomedical data
Experience in considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you’ll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

aignostics.com
Show more

Title: Machine learning scientist or engineer
Description:
The Max Delbrück Center for Molecular Medicine (MDC) in the Helmholtz Association is an international biomedical research center dedicated to understanding the molecular mechanisms of health and disease with the goal to devise new diagnostics and medicines. The MDC is a member of the Helmholtz Association, Germany's largest scientific organization, and offers an engaging research environment with cutting-edge research infrastructure. Currently, ~1250 employees and ~500 guest scientists work at the Berlin-Buch and Berlin-Mitte campuses. Our diverse workforce is a core strength that inspires creativity and innovation at the MDC.

The MDC is committed to improving human health through transformative biomedical research. Our goal is to pioneer discoveries for preventing, treating, and ultimately curing disease.

We are currently seeking a highly motivated and experienced Machine Learning Scientist or engineer with experience or interest in biological data analysis to join our team. The successful candidate will be working on a project focused on clinical decision making and omics analysis. This is a translational project that aims to validate the utility of our AI-enabled platforms for biomedical research.

Responsibilities


Use Large Language Models and other foundation models in the context of clinical and omics data
Develop and implement machine learning algorithms for the analysis of large-scale omics data, including genomic,


transcriptomic, and proteomic data.


Work with experimental scientists to design and execute experiments to validate drug targets and biomarkers discovered through machine learning
Collaborate with other team members to integrate and interpret data from multiple sources
Present research findings at internal and external meetings and conferences
Contribute to the publication of scientific papers in high-impact journals
Contribute to grant applications or other funding applications to further the project


Job Description

Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to analyze large-scale omics data (including genomic, transcriptomic and proteomic data) in addition to protein structure and chemistry data. Collaborate with other team members to integrate and interpret data from multiple sources.

Collaborate with collaborators and companies to design and execute experiments to validate drug targets, drugs and biomarkers discovered through machine learning.

Contribute to the publication and presentation of scientific papers in journals and conferences. Collaborate on grant or other funding applications to advance the project.

Requirements


PhD in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Math, chemical engineering or a related field with a focus on machine learning. Or BSc in a quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Chemical Engineering) with demonstrated experience in deep learning applications in life sciences domain.
Experience in the analysis of large-scale omics data, including genomic, transcriptomic, and proteomic data is needed for at least one position.
Experience with cloud infrastructure and tool deployment on cloud, particularly AWS, is a plus.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn and/or pyTorch.
Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills and the ability to think creatively.


This is an exciting opportunity to work in an innovative and dynamic research environment and make a significant impact in the field of precision medicine and cancer research.

We offer


international working environment with communication in English and German
interesting career opportunities and a range of opportunities for further qualification and training
Compatibility of family and career certified by the workandfamily audit (“berufundfamilie audit”)
Support for "New Berliners" through the MDC Welcome & Family Office


You Also Benefit From


a remuneration in accordance with the collective agreement for the federal public service (TVöD-Bund), including additional company pension schemes
flexible working hours and childcare support
a secure job
Subsidy for the job ticket
additional health benefits such as flu vaccination, eye test, ergonomics advice at the workplace
the possibility of mobile working

HTML:
The Max Delbrück Center for Molecular Medicine (MDC) in the Helmholtz Association is an international biomedical research center dedicated to understanding the molecular mechanisms of health and disease with the goal to devise new diagnostics and medicines. The MDC is a member of the Helmholtz Association, Germany's largest scientific organization, and offers an engaging research environment with cutting-edge research infrastructure. Currently, ~1250 employees and ~500 guest scientists work at the Berlin-Buch and Berlin-Mitte campuses. Our diverse workforce is a core strength that inspires creativity and innovation at the MDC.

The MDC is committed to improving human health through transformative biomedical research. Our goal is to pioneer discoveries for preventing, treating, and ultimately curing disease.

We are currently seeking a highly motivated and experienced Machine Learning Scientist or engineer with experience or interest in biological data analysis to join our team. The successful candidate will be working on a project focused on clinical decision making and omics analysis. This is a translational project that aims to validate the utility of our AI-enabled platforms for biomedical research.

Responsibilities

  • Use Large Language Models and other foundation models in the context of clinical and omics data
  • Develop and implement machine learning algorithms for the analysis of large-scale omics data, including genomic,

transcriptomic, and proteomic data.

  • Work with experimental scientists to design and execute experiments to validate drug targets and biomarkers discovered through machine learning
  • Collaborate with other team members to integrate and interpret data from multiple sources
  • Present research findings at internal and external meetings and conferences
  • Contribute to the publication of scientific papers in high-impact journals
  • Contribute to grant applications or other funding applications to further the project

Job Description

Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to analyze large-scale omics data (including genomic, transcriptomic and proteomic data) in addition to protein structure and chemistry data. Collaborate with other team members to integrate and interpret data from multiple sources.

Collaborate with collaborators and companies to design and execute experiments to validate drug targets, drugs and biomarkers discovered through machine learning.

Contribute to the publication and presentation of scientific papers in journals and conferences. Collaborate on grant or other funding applications to advance the project.

Requirements

  • PhD in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Math, chemical engineering or a related field with a focus on machine learning. Or BSc in a quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Chemical Engineering) with demonstrated experience in deep learning applications in life sciences domain.
  • Experience in the analysis of large-scale omics data, including genomic, transcriptomic, and proteomic data is needed for at least one position.
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure and tool deployment on cloud, particularly AWS, is a plus.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn and/or pyTorch.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills and the ability to think creatively.

This is an exciting opportunity to work in an innovative and dynamic research environment and make a significant impact in the field of precision medicine and cancer research.

We offer

  • international working environment with communication in English and German
  • interesting career opportunities and a range of opportunities for further qualification and training
  • Compatibility of family and career certified by the workandfamily audit (“berufundfamilie audit”)
  • Support for "New Berliners" through the MDC Welcome & Family Office

You Also Benefit From

  • a remuneration in accordance with the collective agreement for the federal public service (TVöD-Bund), including additional company pension schemes
  • flexible working hours and childcare support
  • a secure job
  • Subsidy for the job ticket
  • additional health benefits such as flu vaccination, eye test, ergonomics advice at the workplace
  • the possibility of mobile working

Title: ML Engineer - NLP (m/f/d)
Description:
🎤 Why voize? Because we’re more than just a job!

At voize, we’re revolutionizing the healthcare industry with AI: Nurses simply speak their documentation into their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each nurse an average of 39 minutes per day, improves the quality of documentation, and makes their daily work much more rewarding.

Voize is YCombinator-funded, already in use at over 600 senior care homes, and has grown by 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually – time spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our self-developed voize AI, we’re transforming not only the healthcare industry, but also have the potential to create value in many other sectors – from healthcare to inspections.

As a dynamic team, we blend cutting-edge technology with social impact. And now, it’s your turn to join us!




💡 Your Mission

If you're excited to work at the cutting edge of product design, applied ML research, and MLOps, then go ahead and apply! With us, you'll build products with direct user feedback, train AI models with real data, and ship new features to production every day.




🚀 Your Daily Business – No two days are alike

Take ownership for the design, training, evaluation, and deployment of our deep learning models in the space of speech recognition and NLP
The models you build and refine are at the heart of our applications and directly impact the end-user
You'll get to engineer large self-supervised trainings as well as fast inference for mobile devices and hosted environments




🤝 Your Skillset – What You Bring To The Table

Several years experience with Python and deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch)
You bring experience in speech recognition or NLP & transformer models
Best practices in software engineering come second-nature to you, like Git, Testing, Docker, Clean-code, etc




🎯 Our Success Mindset – How we work at voize

You speak fluent German (B2 or higher) & good English to communicate effectively with our team and customersResilience is one of your strengths – you see challenges as opportunities, not obstacles
Iterative working suits you – you test, learn, and improve constantly instead of waiting for perfection
Communication & feedback come naturally to you – you openly address issues and both give and receive constructive feedback




🌱 Growing together – what you can expect at voize

Become a co-creator of our success with virtual stock options
Our office is in Berlin, and we offer remote work
We provide flexible working hours because you know best when you work most efficiently!
Access to various learning platforms (e.g., Blinkist, Audible, etc.)
We have an open culture and organize regular work weeks and team events to collaborate and bond
We are a fast-growing startup, so you'll encounter various challenges, providing the perfect foundation for rapid personal growth
Your work will make a real impact, helping alleviate the workload for healthcare professionals
Free Germany Ticket and Urban Sports Club membership
30 days of vacation – plus your birthday off




✨ Ready to talk? Apply now! 🚀

We look forward to your application and can’t wait to meet you – no matter who you are or what background you have!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Werde Data Scientist bei smedo

 

Über uns: Bei smedo sind wir auf einer Mission, die Welt der kontaktlosen Biometrie-Technologie zu revolutionieren. Stell dir vor, du misst Vitalzeichen wie Herzfrequenz, Herzvariabilität und Atemfrequenz, ohne die Person zu berühren oder zu sehen – genau das tun wir! Unsere Technologie ist so präzise und vielseitig, dass es fast wie Magie wirkt (aber es ist einfach wirklich gute Wissenschaft). Werde Teil unseres Teams und mach das Gesundheitswesen intelligenter, Herzschlag für Herzschlag.




Aufgaben:

Tauche in Datenmeere ein und fische die wertvollsten Erkenntnisse heraus.
Entwickle und implementiere Machine-Learning-Modelle, die unsere Technologie noch schlauer machen.
Arbeite mit brillanten Köpfen aus verschiedenen Abteilungen zusammen, um reale Probleme zu lösen.
Präsentiere deine Ergebnisse den Stakeholdern so, dass selbst deine Oma sie versteht.
Halte unsere Dateninfrastruktur am Laufen, als wäre sie eine gut geölte Maschine.




Anforderungen:

Nachgewiesene Erfahrung als Data Scientist (wir sprechen von echter Erfahrung, nicht nur einem schicken Titel).
Beherrschung statistischer Methoden und Datenanalyse (die Dinge, die dich wie einen Zauberer aussehen lassen).
Beherrschung von Python (weil wer liebt nicht eine gute Programmiersprache?).
Erfahrung mit Machine-Learning-Frameworks (Extrapunkte, wenn du unseren Modellen das Tanzen beibringen kannst).
Vertrautheit mit Radar ist von Vorteil (wir sprechen nicht vom Wetter).
Hervorragende Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und Detailgenauigkeit (denn der Teufel steckt im Detail).
Starke Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeiten (wir sind eine freundliche Truppe, versprochen).
Professionelle Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (damit du uns in zwei Sprachen beeindrucken kannst).




Was wir bieten:

Eine kollaborative und innovative Arbeitsumgebung (wo deine Ideen zählen).
Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung (weil wir an dein Potenzial glauben).
Wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalts- und Leistungspaket (wir wissen, dass du es wert bist).




Bewerbung: Wenn du leidenschaftlich an Data Science interessiert bist und einen echten Unterschied machen möchtest, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung! Nutze den Bewerbungsprozess von LinkedIn und lass uns gemeinsam Datenmagie erschaffen!




-----------------------------




Become a Data Scientist at smedo

 

About Us: At smedo, we are on a mission to revolutionize the world of contactless biometric technology. Imagine measuring vital signs like heart rate, heart variability, and respiration rate without even touching or seeing the person – that's what we do! Our tech is so precise and versatile, it feels like magic (but it's just really good science). Join us and be part of a team that's making healthcare smarter, one heartbeat at a time.

 

Responsibilities:

Dive into oceans of data and fish out the most valuable insights.
Craft and deploy machine learning models that make our tech even smarter.
Team up with brilliant minds across departments to solve real-world problems.
Present your findings to stakeholders in a way that even your grandma would understand.
Keep our data infrastructure running smoother than a well-oiled machine.

 

Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist (we're talking about real experience, not just a fancy title).
Mastery of statistical methods and data analysis (you know, the stuff that makes you look like a wizard).
Proficiency in Python (because who doesn't love a good programming language?).
Experience with machine learning frameworks (bonus points if you can teach our models to dance).
Familiarity with Radar is a plus (we're not talking about the weather kind).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail (because the devil is in the data).
Strong communication and teamwork abilities (we're a friendly bunch, promise).
Proficiency in both German and English at a professional level (so you can impress us in two languages).

 

What We Offer:

A collaborative and innovative work environment (where your ideas matter).
Opportunities for professional growth and development (because we believe in your potential).
Competitive salary and benefits package (we know you're worth it).

 

How to Apply: If you're passionate about data science and ready to make a real impact, we want to hear from you! Apply now through LinkedIn application process and hear from us soon! 

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 3,000 products with a focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world’s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

In your role as a Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d), you will get the chance to work in a cross-functional team and have a direct impact on the business by building state-of-the-art ML models. The problem space we work in relates to improving and optimizing last mile delivery operations. Forecasting demand, estimating delivery times, optimizing routes and delivery areas are examples of problems we work on.

You can expect to work on business-critical projects in close collaboration with various Flink stakeholders as well as with our Engineering teams. Get ready to be immersed in the fast-paced environment of quick commerce where data is a first-class citizen.

Job Description


Lead and mentor team members in developing advanced models that generate insightful predictions and enable the steering of day-to-day business decisions
Partner with internal stakeholders to identify the best ways to integrate our Data Science products in our quick grocery and workforce apps
Ensure and drive excellence within the Data Science team by ensuring projects follow best practices and proper monitoring of impact
Analyze data to evaluate the impact of our models and to identify opportunities for improvement


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in applying diverse Data Science methodologies to solve real-world business problems in production environments using Python
Proficient in writing and reading SQL (experience with Google BigQuery is a plus)
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English


Bonus


Expertise in at least two of the following domains: last-mile delivery, logistics, optimization, time series analysis
Experience with tools and technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow, and cloud infrastructure (e.g., GCP)
Familiarity with ML platforms like MLflow or Vertex AI
Experience deploying, running, and monitoring real-time machine learning models


Additional Information


A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Staff Data Scientist (New Verticals)
Description:
Job Description

About the New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt the best place to order what you need, be it groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, or other goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world’s best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!)

About The Marketing & Affordability Analytics Team

Our Marketing & Affordability Analytics team uncovers insights on growth opportunities and consumer experience. We partner with Product, Engineering and Business teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You’ll collaborate with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals who take ownership of the business outcomes. As we’re looking to grow to the next level of maturity, you’ll play a key role in establishing analytical expertise in various business domains.

About The Role

We’re looking for an awesome Staff Data Scientist in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You will be the partner for the New Verticals business and act as the go-getter analytics expert of your domain. You’ll have an opportunity to make a domain-wide impact, by partnering with senior leaders closely and driving the action from the frontlines.

The scope of the role ranges from helping cross-functional teams use various data points to size the potential opportunities, identifying and measuring levers to help move essential metrics, leveraging your technical and analytical skills to tell stories about business performance and make recommendations, and aligning executives around what matters and why.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
6+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position
Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing, causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
Ability to build intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence critical business decisions on senior leadership level, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach independently.
Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

About the New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt the best place to order what you need, be it groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, or other goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world’s best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!)

About The Marketing & Affordability Analytics Team

Our Marketing & Affordability Analytics team uncovers insights on growth opportunities and consumer experience. We partner with Product, Engineering and Business teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You’ll collaborate with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals who take ownership of the business outcomes. As we’re looking to grow to the next level of maturity, you’ll play a key role in establishing analytical expertise in various business domains.

About The Role

We’re looking for an awesome Staff Data Scientist in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You will be the partner for the New Verticals business and act as the go-getter analytics expert of your domain. You’ll have an opportunity to make a domain-wide impact, by partnering with senior leaders closely and driving the action from the frontlines.

The scope of the role ranges from helping cross-functional teams use various data points to size the potential opportunities, identifying and measuring levers to help move essential metrics, leveraging your technical and analytical skills to tell stories about business performance and make recommendations, and aligning executives around what matters and why.

Our offering to you

  • The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
  • You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
  • You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.

Our humble expectations

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 6+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position
  • Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
  • Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing, causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
  • Ability to build intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence critical business decisions on senior leadership level, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
  • Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach independently.
  • Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.

Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: (Principal) Data Scientist
Description:
We are Gemma Analytics: a Berlin-based company specializing in generating insights in high-performance data infrastructure. Gemma was founded in early 2020 by two data enthusiasts. Ever since, we have helped over 70 companies to become more data-driven and successful. We have a fun, honest, and inclusive work environment. We are always looking for data-minded people we can learn from.


Tasks


About the Job




At Gemma Analytics, we help businesses unlock the power of data to drive smarter decisions. As we expand our capabilities in data science, we’re looking for a (Principal) Data Scientist to take the lead in shaping and scaling this new vertical.




This is a unique opportunity for a pragmatic and business-focused data scientist who thrives in delivering real-world impact rather than research-driven models. You’ll work hands-on with machine learning, advanced analytics, and AI-driven solutions—while also collaborating with clients and stakeholders to align data science initiatives with business goals.




Responsibilities:





Build the Data Science vertical: Define and develop the capabilities, processes, and strategies to establish data science as a key service


Lead end-to-end data science projects – From problem identification to deployment and impact measurement, ensuring models are practical, scalable, and aligned with business needs


Develop and deploy machine learning models – Expertise in supervised and unsupervised ML techniques (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) and their application in areas like demand forecasting, churn prediction, and pricing optimization


Act as a trusted advisor, collaborating with clients to understand their challenges and deliver practical, impactful solutions


Stay hands-on with data engineering & analytics – Work with SQL, Python (pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy), and modern cloud data stacks (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) to prepare and process data for modeling


Keep up with emerging trends and tools in data science, leveraging them to improve client results and refine internal processes


Cultivate a collaborative and innovative team culture, mentoring junior team members as the vertical grows



Requirements


You're not just a Data Scientist—you’re a builder, problem-solver, and strategic thinker who knows how to balance technical sophistication with business impact.




Besides that, we are looking for the following:





5+ years of hands-on experience in Data Science, with a proven track record of leading and delivering real-world business-focused ML projects


An entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to work autonomously to build new initiatives


Pragmatism in delivering solutions that balance technical sophistication with business feasibility


Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data science libraries; experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus


Experience deploying models in production environments that interact with modern data warehouses and cloud-based ML services


Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to diverse audiences


Optional: Knowledge of data modeling and data engineering concepts to collaborate effectively with technical teams.



Benefits


We are located in Berlin, close to Nordbahnhof. We are currently 19 colleagues and will grow to 22 colleagues this year. Other perks include:





We are a hybrid company that meets in the office twice a week - one common office day and one flexible day


We allow for intra-EU workcations for up to 3 months a year (extra-EU workcations also if this is allowed)


We have an honest, inclusive work environment and want to nurture this environment


We don’t compromise on equipment - a powerful Laptop, extra screens, and all the tools you need to be effective


We will surround you with great people who love to solve (mostly data) riddles


We believe in efficient working hours rather than long working hours - we focus on the output rather than the input


We learn and share during meetups, lunch & learn sessions and are open to further initiatives


We pay a market-friendly salary and we additionally distribute at least 20% of profits to our employees


We are fast-growing and have technology at our core, yet we do not rely on a VC and operate profitably


We have a great yearly offsite event that brings us all together for a full week, enjoying good food, and having a good time (2021: Austria, 2022: Czech Republic, 2023: Germany, 2024: Germany)






CV screening


Initial conversation


Hiring test


Interviews with 2-3 future colleagues


Reference calls


Offer + Hired
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Pricing Team (m / f / d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio's vision is to enable seamless travel for people anywhere, in any way. We are bringing all global transport options into a single distribution system to create magical end-to-end consumer journeys.

With Omio, you can easily compare and book trains, buses, ferries, and flights across Europe, the US, and Canada using a single search on your mobile, app, or desktop. Omio aims to simplify travel planning by providing transparent pricing and easy booking, making it a flexible and personalised experience.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, working with over 1000 suppliers across 39 countries. Our portfolio also includes Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, attracting over 900 million users annually.

Our offices are located in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London. We are a growing team of over 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who all share the same vision: to create a unified tool to help travellers reach almost any destination in the world.

Job Description

Omio is building the future of travel pricing. We’re moving from manual, rule-based systems to AI-driven dynamic pricing to enhance revenue, efficiency, and competitiveness. As we transition, we’re looking for someone who can both build cutting-edge solutions and champion this shift within the company.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities


Build Models: Develop machine learning models (e.g., time series, RNNs) to forecast demand and optimisation systems to recommend prices dynamically.
Pilot AI Solutions: Design and implement a Proof of Concept (PoC) for dynamic pricing in a test market.
Evangelize AI Pricing: Advocate for the adoption of AI-driven pricing by demonstrating its value to key stakeholders across the business.
Analyse Large Data: Leverage Omio’s data and external factors (like competitor pricing) to optimize pricing decisions.
Drive Automation: Set up systems for real-time anomaly detection and automated price adjustments.


Collaborate: Work with Pricing Commercial, Product, and Engineering teams to integrate AI into business workflows and ensure smooth adoption.

Qualifications


At least 3 years experience in building complex models and algorithms.
Proven ability to design and deploy models in production, ideally for pricing or forecasting.
Strong communication and presentation skills to explain technical concepts and influence non-technical stakeholders at a C-level
Self-driven strong individual contributor requiring minimal hands on support
Experience in building production-ready AI systems from scratch is a big plus


Knowledge & Skills


Passion for driving organizational change and inspiring teams to adopt new, data-driven approaches.
Great communication skills with stakeholders (incl. C-Level)
Focus on solving real business problems rather than building models for theoretical problem-solving
Experience with time-series forecasting, anomaly detection, and Bayesian modelling.
Proficiency in Python, with experience in data science libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Experience of building low-latency / near real-time processing systems.


Additional Information

Here at Omio, we know that no two people are alike, and that’s a great thing. Diversity in culture, thought and background has been key to growing our product beyond borders to reach millions of users from all over the world. That’s why we believe in giving equal opportunity to all, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

What’s in it for you?

Omio encourage you to apply even if you’re still developing some of these skills! We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age or disability.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Berlin
Description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a Senior Applied Scientist (F/M/D) to join the Discovery Collective team in Berlin.

About The Role 🖥️
Based in Berlin, we are building a new team to face fashion search challenges. You will be part of a multicultural, innovative, versatile, supportive environment that takes work-life balance seriously. To have a data driven company is one of our priorities. The Search team is working on delivering high quality search results from 5M+ items, for 80+ markets in 8+ languages. You will work with other software engineers and applied scientists to build Vestiaire Collective’s fashion search & recommendation engine. You will work on hard and fun problems of fashion discovery where personalization matters.

What You will do 👜

Build full pipelines for models to solve use cases for fashion discovery (product recommendation, ranking, personalization…)

Collaborate with business and product and other engineers and applied scientists and deploy your solutions to production.

Ensure model maintenance, monitoring, and scalability are consistently addressed.

Propose and implement R&D POC projects if you identify possible enhancements to the business, and pitch them to the relevant teams.

You will be expected to take on a leadership role on your projects: you will make the appropriate technical choices (algorithms, data transformation, technologies to use), discuss scope & scheduling with collaborators outside the team, and incorporate feedback as needed

Who you are ⭐

Demonstrated ability to create and optimize end-to-end pipelines for machine learning models. You are very familiar with MLOps.

Strong experience in delivering Machine Learning projects which have created impact on production.

Technical knowledge in Deep Learning, Python, SQL, Machine learning & Statistics.

Broad interests in DS and adjacent topics: modelling, statistics, monitoring, data engineering, production.

Experience with cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure), Experience with AB testing

Fluent English (technical interviews will be conducted in English)Initiative, autonomous, communicating with technical and non technical people.

Our Technology Stack includes

Languages: Python, Golang

Application Framework: PyTorch, Airflow, FastAPI, Tensorflow, Torchserve

Data Storage: Snowflake, Redis, Elasticsearch

Others: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Github

More information about our stack : Vestiaire Tech Radar and ourTech Blog

** The role is hybrid, based in Berlin **

What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive compensation and benefits package (i.e 28 days of paid time off)

As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist at Zenjob you will transform our business requirements into innovative data solutions, which effectively support our business.

If you would like to join a friendly team, with limitless potential and an open-minded future driven mindset, you are welcome to join. To be successful in this position the most important thing is to live our values #humble, #honest, #helpful and #hungry. So we are looking for a data driven team player.




Zenjob is on the mission to become the digital staffing platform delivering companies best staffing experience with the highest flexibility and reliability, and workers the best choice and fair pay for side jobs. Our service is available in over 39 cities in Germany. Our growth financing round of $50 million (€45 million) from February 2022 is helping us to scale our platform and add new data-based automation features for our rapidly growing customer base.




What you’ll be doing

Drive cross functional data science projects to understand, predict and influence the behaviour of our users both on B2C and B2B sides
Optimise our product by leveraging advanced analytics and Machine Learning solutions
Train, deploy and integrate production ready models to our backend/frontend services
Design and evaluate A/B tests to validate hypothesis and measure the impact of our solutions
Build data tools for product managers, empowering them to deliver actionable insights and recommendations for respective teams
Collaborate closely with colleagues from Data Science and Analytics teams, provide input and critical reviews to the projects executed by members of the team
Work closely with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align data science initiatives with organizational goals and ensure successful implementation




What you’ll bring

Degree in a quantitative field (e.g. math, physics, computer science)
Extensive professional experience in data science or a related analytical field
Effective utilisation of SQL to query large volumes of data
Proficiency in using Python for data analysis as well as development of production ready solutions
Good understanding as well as hands-on experience with commonly used advanced statistical and ML techniques
Excellent communication skills, ability to efficiently explain technical concepts, analytical results, etc to non-technical audiences
Experience with any of the following tools is a big plus: AWS services (redshift, s3, athena, sagemaker), dbt, airflow, Flask/FastAPI, MLFlow, docker




What we offer

A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1.
Twenty-eight days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1-day special leave paid for charity work, five days of paid educational leave, and the option of unpaid leave.
Hybrid work setup combining office & remote work (3 days from office, 2 days home), flexible working hours, bring your dog policy.
Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations)
Monthly 30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership
Monthly 40 EUR credit for NAVIT- a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport bike-sharing.
Tax-free meal allowance (saving EUR ~50 net per month!)
Quarterly team get togethers, budget for employees birthdays, winter & summer parties plus regular cultural talks & events.




If this sounds good, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application.




If you want to learn more about how our Tech team works, check out our official Zenjob Technology Blog: https://medium.com/zenjob-tech-blog




We invite you to explore our Career Page, follow our LinkedIn page, and connect with us on Instagram.




We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to assessing every qualified person according to their skills, regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. It is not necessary to include your photo and age with your application.

Show more
HTML:
The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist at Zenjob you will transform our business requirements into innovative data solutions, which effectively support our business.

If you would like to join a friendly team, with limitless potential and an open-minded future driven mindset, you are welcome to join. To be successful in this position the most important thing is to live our values #humble, #honest, #helpful and #hungry. So we are looking for a data driven team player.


Zenjob is on the mission to become the digital staffing platform delivering companies best staffing experience with the highest flexibility and reliability, and workers the best choice and fair pay for side jobs. Our service is available in over 39 cities in Germany. Our growth financing round of $50 million (€45 million) from February 2022 is helping us to scale our platform and add new data-based automation features for our rapidly growing customer base.


What you’ll be doing

  • Drive cross functional data science projects to understand, predict and influence the behaviour of our users both on B2C and B2B sides
  • Optimise our product by leveraging advanced analytics and Machine Learning solutions
  • Train, deploy and integrate production ready models to our backend/frontend services
  • Design and evaluate A/B tests to validate hypothesis and measure the impact of our solutions
  • Build data tools for product managers, empowering them to deliver actionable insights and recommendations for respective teams
  • Collaborate closely with colleagues from Data Science and Analytics teams, provide input and critical reviews to the projects executed by members of the team
  • Work closely with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align data science initiatives with organizational goals and ensure successful implementation


What you’ll bring

  • Degree in a quantitative field (e.g. math, physics, computer science)
  • Extensive professional experience in data science or a related analytical field
  • Effective utilisation of SQL to query large volumes of data
  • Proficiency in using Python for data analysis as well as development of production ready solutions
  • Good understanding as well as hands-on experience with commonly used advanced statistical and ML techniques
  • Excellent communication skills, ability to efficiently explain technical concepts, analytical results, etc to non-technical audiences
  • Experience with any of the following tools is a big plus: AWS services (redshift, s3, athena, sagemaker), dbt, airflow, Flask/FastAPI, MLFlow, docker


What we offer

  • A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1.
  • Twenty-eight days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1-day special leave paid for charity work, five days of paid educational leave, and the option of unpaid leave.
  • Hybrid work setup combining office & remote work (3 days from office, 2 days home), flexible working hours, bring your dog policy.
  • Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations)
  • Monthly 30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership
  • Monthly 40 EUR credit for NAVIT- a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport bike-sharing.
  • Tax-free meal allowance (saving EUR ~50 net per month!)
  • Quarterly team get togethers, budget for employees birthdays, winter & summer parties plus regular cultural talks & events.


If this sounds good, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application.


If you want to learn more about how our Tech team works, check out our official Zenjob Technology Blog: https://medium.com/zenjob-tech-blog


We invite you to explore our Career Page, follow our LinkedIn page, and connect with us on Instagram.


We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to assessing every qualified person according to their skills, regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. It is not necessary to include your photo and age with your application.

Title: Senior AI Developer / Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Description:
Wien, Wels, Linz (AT), Berlin (DE)

ab sofort | Vollzeit | #Hybrid | #senior

Willkommen bei XXXLdigital, wo digitale Innovation echte Wirkung zeigt. Als digitale Organisationseinheit der XXXL-Gruppe widmen wir uns allen Facetten des E-Commerce und stationärem Handel.

Die Zusammenstellung von Produken für die Online-Shops, die Optimierung des Kund:innenerlebnisses und die Abwicklung des digitalen Marketings – all das zählt zu unserem Kerngeschäft. Die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund:innen stehen bei uns im Mittelpunkt, um ein nahtloses Omnichannel-Einkaufserlebnis zu bieten. Unsere Vision ist es, mit unseren Online-Shops und Filialen der marktführende Möbel- und Einrichtungshändler zu sein.

Bei XXXLdigital schätzen wir Authentizität und Vielfalt. Wir fördern ein Umfeld, in dem du dich wirklich entfalten und dein Potential voll nutzen kannst.

Das Bist Du


Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Leitung und Umsetzung komplexer AI-Projekte sowie nachweisbare Erfolge in der Entwicklung produktiver Lösungen.
Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Arbeit mit Google Cloud (Cloud Run, Vertex AI), Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, Docker, GitHub und VS Code.
Expertise in Machine Learning, Deep Learning und Generative AI sowie deren Integration in großangelegte Projekte.
Fähigkeit, ein Team durch technisches Wissen und strategisches Denken zu fördern und voranzubringen.
Strukturierte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise, Eigeninitiative sowie Offenheit für Wissens- und Erfahrungsaustausch.
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse, sowie fortgeschrittene Englischkenntnisse


Das Sind Deine Aufgaben


Konzeption und Implementierung innovativer AI-Lösungen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren AI DevOps Engineers, um Anwendungen nahtlos in unsere Infrastruktur zu integrieren.
Auswahl der geeignetsten, rechtlich einsetzbaren Modelle für komplexe Use Cases in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing & Generation sowie Predictive AI – stets mit Blick auf Effizienz und Kostenstrategien.
Anpassung und Optimierung durch Transfer Learning, Fine-Tuning oder Integration in RAG-Lösungen, stets mit Fokus auf ein effizientes Kosten-Nutzen-Verhältnis.
Weiterentwicklung des Tech-Stacks, Evaluation neuer Technologien und maßgebliche Mitgestaltung der technologischen Ausrichtung des Unternehmens.
Unterstützung und Förderung des Teams durch Weitergabe von Wissen, Etablierung von Best Practices und Stärkung der Teamkompetenzen.
Sicherstellung der Qualität und Automatisierung von Modelltraining und Deployment mit Hilfe von Vertex AI Pipelines.


Das Erwartet Dich


Gesundheit & Wohlfühlen: Gratis Kaffee, Tee, Getränke, frisches Obst und Gemüse sowie vergünstigte Mahlzeiten in der Kantine oder Essenszuschüsse (standortabhängig). Moderne Arbeitsplätze für alle Bedürfnisse.
Kultur & Entwicklung: Wir schätzen Eigenverantwortung, flache Hierarchien und offenes Feedback. Wir leben einen Teamgeist, in dem Unterstützung und Zusammenarbeit großgeschrieben werden. Genieße 2 Learning-Days pro Quartal, einen internen Lerncampus und externe Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten.
Flexible Work-Life Balance: Genieße flexible Arbeitszeiten und diverse Möglichkeiten für Remote Work.
Feiern & Meilensteine: Teamevents und besondere Aufmerksamkeiten für Geburtstage und Jubiläen.
Standortspezifische Benefits: Maßgeschneiderte Benefits, die auf die Bedürfnisse der jeweiligen Standorte zugeschnitten sind.


Über XXXLdigital

Wir scheuen nicht die Vielfalt – wir feiern sie. Sei du selbst und zeig uns wer du bist!

Unsere beliebtesten Benefits

Gesunde Snacks

Remote Work

Kaffee & Getränke

Öffi Anbindung

Weiterbildung

Rabatte

Top Hardware

Teamevents

Das Mindestgehalt für diese Position beträgt 38.038 € brutto pro Jahr (Vollzeit) , je nach Qualifikation/Ausbildung - eine weitere Überzahlung ist natürlich je nach Berufserfahrung und Marktorientierung möglich.

Let’s excite together!

Interesse? Stefan f reut sich auf deine Bewerbung:
