Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d) Machine Learning Ops
Description:
As a Machine Learning Operation Engineer (ML OPS) you are part of our ED&AA Unit at Siemens Energy and work on challenging projects from all areas of the energy industry. You will transform Machine Learning models to well-engineered products fulfilling development, deployment and monitoring requirements and standards.

Let’s Talk About You!

What You Bring


Hands-on experience with ML frameworks, libraries, agile environments and deploying machine learning solutions using DevOps principles.
Excellent knowledge of data science programming languages (Python, R, Scala).
Excellent knowledge of the boto3 AWS SDK or additional SDKs for other cloud platforms.
Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure.
Excellent knowledge of container technologies (docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift etc.).
Familiar with REST API protocol as well as at least model serving technologies (MLFlow, Seldon Core, Kubeflow, TFX, Sagemaker endpoints etc.).
Excellent knowledge of the ML life-cycle.
Experience in creation of CI/CD pipelines for machine learning projects.



How You Will Make An Impact


Deploy, operationalize and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models with a focus on optimization of model hyperparameters, automated retraining and model training, version control and governance and model monitoring and its drift.
Establish model onboarding, operations, and decommissioning workflows.
Track, snapshot & manage assets used to create the models.
Enable collaboration, sharing and standardization of ML pipelines developed by data scientists.
Maintain model asset integrity & persist access control logs.
Certify model behavior meets regulatory & adversarial standards. You will be heavily supported by data scientists and Subject Matter Experts in this task
Support model portability across a variety of platforms. We do not have cloud-agnostic ML pipelines, but dependencies should be minimal.
Certify model performance meets functional and latency requirements.
Evaluate design patterns for model deployment. Evaluate design patterns for unit testing and integration testing for machine learning products.
Create and maintain scalable ML Ops frameworks to support product-specific models.



Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With ~100,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits


An inclusive team culture where you can be yourself
Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
Welfare: flexible welfare programs and health insurance.



https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs


Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation™
Description:
SR2 are partnered with a global consultancy who are looking for Data Science specialists.




In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and statistical modeling to help clients uncover trends, patterns, and insights from their data. You will work on projects involving data collection, cleaning, visualization, and interpretation, turning complex datasets into actionable insights that inform business strategy. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in programming languages like Python or R, and experience with data visualisation and statistical techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python and data analysis libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn.
Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Databricks is essential.
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.




Role

6-12+ month contract with high probability of extension
Hybrid with occasional travel to Munich
Candidates have to be based in Germany
2x Stage interview process




If you're passionate about using data to solve real-world business challenges, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation GmbH




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing personalized recommendations including size and fit, style, and alternative product suggestions. Our technologies support shoppers and retailers alike by reducing returns, increasing conversions, enhancing customer satisfaction, and ultimately helping the environment.




As a trusted partner of leading global apparel and footwear retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to optimizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.




Role Overview:

Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Senior Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in driving the success of our cutting-edge recommendation solutions. As a seasoned professional, you will contribute to projects in production with your strong ML and SWE skillset. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to pave the way forward with innovative ideas and bring them to life.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop state of the art solutions for apparel sizing, style, and product recommendations.
Experience with implementing the lifecycle of ML solutions
Champion best practices in code quality, review, and software architecture.
Drive continuous innovation in ML techniques and strategies to maintain competitive advantage and keep pace with industry standards.
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align ML technologies with business goals and enhance customer outcomes.




Requirements and Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Senior Data Scientist, particularly in recommendation systems and scalable ML solutions.
Proficient in Python and SQL.
Extensive experience with ML frameworks and tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and ML serving technologies like TensorFlow Serving or NVIDIA Triton.
Proficient in developing and optimizing ML pipelines, model deployment, and serving strategies.
Strong record of software engineering best practices, including testing, data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis.
Proactive attitude towards organizational growth, personal development and developing team spirit
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively with all levels of an organization.

Title: Data Scientist, Traveler Data Products
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

At GetYourGuide (GYG), we're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.

Join the Traveler Data Products Team, where we are passionate about creating data-driven solutions that empower travelers to discover and connect with the perfect experiences. Our mission is to make our vast inventory accessible and relevant by tailoring it to individual interests, extracting valuable insights from product descriptions, and customizing page layouts to meet our users' unique needs. We are also at the forefront of exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can accelerate the discovery of relevant products, ensuring a seamless and enriching customer journey.

As a valued member of our inclusive and dynamic team, you will collaborate closely with fellow Data Scientists and MLOps Engineers, continuously innovating to enhance the relevance and personalization of the products we display. Together, we strive to make every travel experience unforgettable.

You Will


Develop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.
Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:
Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.
Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.


Who You Are

Ideal candidates will have experience in most of the following areas:


Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a plus.
Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.
Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.
Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.
Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


We value potential and enthusiasm as much as experience. If you are passionate about data science and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the criteria listed above.

How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more
HTML:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

At GetYourGuide (GYG), we're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.

Join the Traveler Data Products Team, where we are passionate about creating data-driven solutions that empower travelers to discover and connect with the perfect experiences. Our mission is to make our vast inventory accessible and relevant by tailoring it to individual interests, extracting valuable insights from product descriptions, and customizing page layouts to meet our users' unique needs. We are also at the forefront of exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can accelerate the discovery of relevant products, ensuring a seamless and enriching customer journey.

As a valued member of our inclusive and dynamic team, you will collaborate closely with fellow Data Scientists and MLOps Engineers, continuously innovating to enhance the relevance and personalization of the products we display. Together, we strive to make every travel experience unforgettable.

You Will

  • Develop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.
  • Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:
  • Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.
  • Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.

Who You Are

Ideal candidates will have experience in most of the following areas:

  • Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a plus.
  • Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.
  • Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.
  • Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.
  • Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

We value potential and enthusiasm as much as experience. If you are passionate about data science and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the criteria listed above.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
  • A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
  • Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
  • English-speaking office environment
  • Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
  • Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
  • Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
  • Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
  • Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies
  • Relocation assistance if needed

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Scientist, Germany - BCG X
Description:
Locations: München | Berlin | Frankfurt

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills in both German and English


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Additional info

Professional Development

We are committed to your growth. You will have ample opportunities to participate in training programs, workshops, and development initiatives. You will also benefit from coaching and mentoring to further enhance your skills and expertise. At BCG, you can explore new horizons and expand your potential.

Join the Group

Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now and become part of a community of forward-thinkers. Here, challenges and collaboration go hand in hand, your ideas are valued, and your potential knows no bounds. Let’s work together to develop innovative solutions and create a lasting impact on businesses and society.

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Your mission

At Klim, we've pioneered the world’s first digital platform for regenerative agriculture, empowering thousands of farmers to champion sustainable practices. We provide financial compensation to farmers for their regenerative practices and offer high-quality advisory services. We connect the farmers with forward-thinking companies who want to invest in a greener future. By purchasing the carbon credits generated from these sustainable practices or implementing regenerative agriculture in their food supply chain, these companies not only fulfill their environmental responsibilities but also fuel a cycle of positive change.

Now, we're looking for a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to be at the forefront of change, helping develop sophisticated data products to aid farmers in their transition to regenerative agriculture.

Backed by visionary investors like Atlantic Food Labs, Ananda Impact Ventures, and AgFunder, we're on a trajectory of growth and innovation. If you're ready to make a difference and be part of something truly meaningful, join us at Klim, and together, let's cultivate a brighter tomorrow for all.

As Data Scientist You Will


Build and optimize ML models for agronomic recommendations.
Work with diverse datasets to generate insights.
Proactively assess and identify opportunities for data science applications, data products, and automations.
Build robust, scalable data models to support ML systems and improve data accessibility.
Collaborate cross-functionally with agronomists, engineers, and product teams.


Your profile


MSc/PhD in data science, agronomy, computer science, or related fields.
Proven track record in building recommendation systems or predictive data science projects, ideally related to agriculture.
Preferred knowledge of agronomy and agricultural topics.
Proficiency in Python and SQL with experience using ML frameworks and libraries such as PyTorch and scikit-learn.
Familiarity with the AWS ecosystem.
Experience collaborating with engineering and product teams, with proficiency in version controlling (e.g., Git).
Ability to translate business requirements into quantitative solutions and clearly communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Experience working with large-scale geospatial and sensor data and familiarity with remote sensing a plus.
Full working proficiency in English. German is a plus.


Benefits

Opportunity: Be part of our journey from the very beginning, working on an equal footing with the leadership team to build a new company

Impact: Make a daily and active contribution to combating climate change, promoting consumer education, and fostering fair conditions for our climate-conscious farmers

Autonomy: Take ownership of your projects and enjoy a high degree of creative freedom

Competitive package: Receive a competitive salary and have the opportunity to participate in our VSIP program

Flexible work model: At Klim, we foster a flexible, hybrid work approach and facilitate hybrid/remote work (within Germany). It is advantageous for this role if you live in Berlin or can be present in our office regularly.

Additional benefits: We offer membership in the Urban Sports Club or the Deutschlandticket, team lunches (if in Berlin) and regular team events.

We're looking forward to meeting you!

At Klim, we believe that a thriving workplace is built on the diverse backgrounds, talents, and perspectives of our team. We grow stronger together by embracing and building on each individual’s unique strengths.

We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute their best. All hiring and personnel decisions are made solely based on qualifications, performance, and the needs of the company - ensuring fairness and equal opportunity for all.

If you’re excited about this role but don’t meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You might be the perfect fit for our team in ways you don’t yet realise!

About Us

At Klim, we’re creating a joint movement with farmers and businesses to make regenerative agriculture scalable and impactful. As a Berlin-based AgriTech start-up, we’re empowering farmers to restore soil, boost biodiversity, and capture carbon—all while earning revenue through our platform.

Backed by $22 million in Series A funding, we’re expanding globally, partnering with major food industry leaders like Nestlé and Kaufland to help them reduce emissions along their supply chains, while making them more resilient and profitable at the same time. Since 2020, we’ve supported 3,500 farmers, covering 700,000 hectares (5% of Germany’s farmland!).

If you’re passionate about building a sustainable food system and driving real climate impact, join us and help create a healthier planet!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior ML Engineer

Location: Berlin / Hybrid (2 days on-site)

Salary: €95k - €110k




WHO’S THIS WITH?




Very successful, respected and leading fashion and lifestyle on-line retailer, a Berlin success story in itself.
You will be joining as a senior engineering member in a team looking to integrate Machine Learning into what they are currently working across




WHAT’S THE ROLE?




Senior Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in image generation and computer vision
Being the lead in ML engineering to enable the building of future shaping content production tooling




WHAT DO I NEED TO BE GOOD AT?




Assessing various different solutions, tools or AI models
InnovatIng, consultanting, developing and making decisions on integrating the right AI solutions into the existing infrastructure
ETL pipelines, AWS Sagemaker, Bedrock and general ML/AI experience
Technical Leadership




WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?




Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong software engineering skills with Python and ideally one other language like Kotlin or Java
3D representation, PyTorch, Keras, and TensorFlow




BENEFITS, PERKS, BONUSES




Wide range of benefits including large on-line discounts, shares programme, working abroad allowance, family, health and well-being services and many many more.
You will be joining a company where a vision of sustainability, diversity, inclusion and community is a continuing key part of the culture




Extra.

This is a hybrid role, based in Berlin (top location) with an expectance to ideally be on-site / in office for 2 days a week.

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) in den Bereichen NLP und LLM (Entwicklung/ Betrieb, Kompetenzaufbau und Support)
Description:
Die DIN Solutions GmbH steht innerhalb der DIN-Gruppe für eine hohe technische Expertise und ist verantwortlich für die Entwicklung und den Betrieb von Software, Plattformen und Datenbanken. Unsere Aufgabe ist es, (Kunden-)Anforderungen in technische Lösungen zu übersetzen. Darüber hinaus entwickeln wir Lösungen für Normenanwender und Kooperationspartner der DIN-Gruppe.

Wir suchen ab sofort in Berlin - unbefristet -

Data Scientist (m/w/d) in den Bereichen NLP und LLM (Entwicklung/ Betrieb, Kompetenzaufbau und Support)

Aufgaben

Wir suchen einen Data Scientist (m/w/d) in den Bereichen Natural Language Processing (NLP) und Large Language Models (LLM). In dieser Rolle unterstützt Du unser Team bei der Entwicklung und Anwendung von NLP- und LLM-Technologien zusammen mit weiteren erfahrenen Kolleg*innen. Du erhältst die Gelegenheit, in einem dynamischen und kreativen Umfeld der Normung und Normen-Anwendung zu arbeiten und Dich im Bereich der natürlichen Sprachverarbeitung zu verwirklichen.


Entwicklung von KI-Assistenten für Normen-Anwender und innerbetriebliche Prozesse der DIN-Gruppe mithilfe von Large Language Models (LLMs) und Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Anwendung von Natural Language Processing (NLP) Methoden, Anpassung von Machine Learning Modellen und LLMs, um Wissen aus Normen-Daten automatisch zu extrahieren und zu strukturieren.
Planung, Entwicklung, Betrieb und Optimierung von Infrastrukturen mit Hilfe von DevOps, LLMOps, und Cloud-Diensten, um die Bereitstellung und den Betrieb zukünftiger KI-Lösungen sicherzustellen.
Arbeiten in interdisziplinären Teams, um Entwicklungen in bestehende und neue Produkte und Lösungen der DIN Media zu integrieren
Entwicklung von Prototypen und Bewertung von Technologien, die als Grundlage für neue und innovative Produkte und Lösungen dienen
Projektmanagement und Projektsupport für KI-Projekte mit externen Dienstleistern
Mitarbeit in DIN- und KI-Netzwerken und die Unterstützung bei DIN-gruppenweitem Wissensaufbau im Bereich Künstliche Intelligenz


Profil


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Diplom, Master) in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Computerlinguistik, Software Engineering, Data Engineering, Mathematik) oder vergleichbarer Fachrichtung
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python und Erfahrung mit ML-Frameworks (z.B. TensorFlow, PyTorch, spaCy, LangChain, LlamaIndex) und Data-Science-Toolsets (z.B. pandas, numpy, scikit-learn)
Praktische Erfahrung mit Machine Learning, insbesondere mit neuronalen Netzwerken, Large Language Models (LLMs) und der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen
Praktische Erfahrung mit Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Vektordatenbanken und/oder der Anpassung von Open Source LLMs auf domänenspezifischen Anwendungen
Erfahrung mit DevOps-Praktiken (z. B. GitLab, Docker, CI/CD, Kubernetes) im Allgemeinen und MLOps/LLMOps im Speziellen, sowie mit Cloud Infrastrukturen (z.B. Azure AI, AKS)
Kenntnisse in der Erstellung und Nutzung von Wissensgraphen sowie Erfahrung im Ontologie-Lernen sind wünschenswert
Fundierte Erfahrung im Projektmanagement und Netzwerken
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Wir bieten


35 Std./Woche (Vollzeit)
Maxi-Flex-Modell: Möglichkeit der Anhebung der Wochenarbeitszeit auf bis zu 42 Std./Woche
Flexible Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeitmodell mit Kernarbeitszeit 10:00 - 14:00 Uhr)
Mobiles Arbeiten möglich
30 Tage Jahresurlaub sowie Betriebsferien zwischen Weihnachten und Neujahr
Ein top modernisiertes Gebäude in zentraler Lage (Wittenbergplatz/Zoologischer Garten)
Kostenfreie Nutzung des hauseigenen Physiozentrums, Zuschuss zum VBB-Firmenticket, JobRad, Sabbatical, Betriebsrestaurant mit bezuschusstem Essen, betriebliche Altersvorsorge etc.
Umfassende und strukturierte Einarbeitung und Betreuung


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Du erhältst die Gelegenheit, in einem dynamischen und kreativen Umfeld der Normung und Normen-Anwendung zu arbeiten und Dich im Bereich der natürlichen Sprachverarbeitung zu verwirklichen.

  • Entwicklung von KI-Assistenten für Normen-Anwender und innerbetriebliche Prozesse der DIN-Gruppe mithilfe von Large Language Models (LLMs) und Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
  • Anwendung von Natural Language Processing (NLP) Methoden, Anpassung von Machine Learning Modellen und LLMs, um Wissen aus Normen-Daten automatisch zu extrahieren und zu strukturieren.
  • Planung, Entwicklung, Betrieb und Optimierung von Infrastrukturen mit Hilfe von DevOps, LLMOps, und Cloud-Diensten, um die Bereitstellung und den Betrieb zukünftiger KI-Lösungen sicherzustellen.
  • Arbeiten in interdisziplinären Teams, um Entwicklungen in bestehende und neue Produkte und Lösungen der DIN Media zu integrieren
  • Entwicklung von Prototypen und Bewertung von Technologien, die als Grundlage für neue und innovative Produkte und Lösungen dienen
  • Projektmanagement und Projektsupport für KI-Projekte mit externen Dienstleistern
  • Mitarbeit in DIN- und KI-Netzwerken und die Unterstützung bei DIN-gruppenweitem Wissensaufbau im Bereich Künstliche Intelligenz

Profil

  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Diplom, Master) in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Computerlinguistik, Software Engineering, Data Engineering, Mathematik) oder vergleichbarer Fachrichtung
  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python und Erfahrung mit ML-Frameworks (z.B. TensorFlow, PyTorch, spaCy, LangChain, LlamaIndex) und Data-Science-Toolsets (z.B. pandas, numpy, scikit-learn)
  • Praktische Erfahrung mit Machine Learning, insbesondere mit neuronalen Netzwerken, Large Language Models (LLMs) und der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen
  • Praktische Erfahrung mit Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Vektordatenbanken und/oder der Anpassung von Open Source LLMs auf domänenspezifischen Anwendungen
  • Erfahrung mit DevOps-Praktiken (z. B. GitLab, Docker, CI/CD, Kubernetes) im Allgemeinen und MLOps/LLMOps im Speziellen, sowie mit Cloud Infrastrukturen (z.B. Azure AI, AKS)
  • Kenntnisse in der Erstellung und Nutzung von Wissensgraphen sowie Erfahrung im Ontologie-Lernen sind wünschenswert
  • Fundierte Erfahrung im Projektmanagement und Netzwerken
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten

  • 35 Std./Woche (Vollzeit)
  • Maxi-Flex-Modell: Möglichkeit der Anhebung der Wochenarbeitszeit auf bis zu 42 Std./Woche
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeitmodell mit Kernarbeitszeit 10:00 - 14:00 Uhr)
  • Mobiles Arbeiten möglich
  • 30 Tage Jahresurlaub sowie Betriebsferien zwischen Weihnachten und Neujahr
  • Ein top modernisiertes Gebäude in zentraler Lage (Wittenbergplatz/Zoologischer Garten)
  • Kostenfreie Nutzung des hauseigenen Physiozentrums, Zuschuss zum VBB-Firmenticket, JobRad, Sabbatical, Betriebsrestaurant mit bezuschusstem Essen, betriebliche Altersvorsorge etc.
  • Umfassende und strukturierte Einarbeitung und Betreuung

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Machine Learning Research Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact.

All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.

Right now, we are seeking highly qualified candidates to fill the position:

Machine Learning Research Scientist (m/f/d)

2 year temporary contract

This role is part of the Pfizer Postdoc program

Pfizer’s biomedical AI hub is seeking a passionate and creative machine learning researcher to design and implement new machine learning tools to accelerate drug discovery. The ideal candidate should have an outstanding scientific reputation in the field of machine learning research for generative chemistry and contrastive learning for drug discovery.

S/he will design new approaches to derive insights from Pfizer’s proprietary data and external datasets to generate testable hypotheses across the drug discovery continuum. The individual will also design, establish, and manage internal and external collaborations to advance Pfizer’s ML capabilities.

About the role:

Principal downstream application domains include, indication expansion, target selection, disease mechanism elucidation, and patient selection, partnering with practitioners in these areas to advance the state-of-the-art.


Develop innovative machine learning approaches that leverage the plethora of Pfizer's proprietary data in conjunction with external data sources to advance drug discovery and identify novel disease treatment mechanisms
Develop a Pfizer internal knowledge-graph for internal and external biomedical data and predict new links for hypothesis generation
Advance the internal graph learning tech-stack to cope with, spurious correlation, obscuring variation and inherent multimodality of biomedical, chemical, and -omics data
Research, design and implement graph learning algorithms for analysis problems related to drug discovery and development
Be an active member of a highly interdisciplinary team
Conceive, execute and evaluate studies and experiments, interpret the results and present them to scientist in other functions
Generate direct impact on our discovery projects to help patients
Strengthen external visibility and scientific excellence through publishing / presenting work in reputed journals and conference/workshop venues and engaging with the scientific community


About you:


Formal training in Physics, Chemisty, Biology, Computational Biology, Statistics, related technical discipline.
PhD and relevant research experience in developing machine/deep learning-based solutions and a sincere interest for computational life sciences.
Hands-on experience in handling, processing, integrating, and analyzing large heterogenous data sets related to industrial drug discovery research with of one or more scientific data modalities
Highly creative person with outstanding problem-solving skills to tackle complex analysis tasks in a timely fashion.
Strong publication record and demonstrated contributions to the field
Solid expertise with ML libraries such as PyTorch, Lightning, TensorFlow is mandatory! Programming skills in Python must be top-notch. Experience with relevant libraries of the Python scientific stack is a big plus.
Familiarity with GPU computing both on-premises and on cloud platforms
Passion and curiosity for data and proven ability to take ideas from prototype to production.
Strong interpersonal skills, distinct collaborative attitude, excellent written and verbal communication


Together we stand for:

Breakthroughs that change patients' lives – In order to fulfill our corporate purpose, a value-oriented corporate culture guides our actions. Pfizer's values are: Courage, Excellence, Equity & Joy.

Courage: One bold way we are achieving our goals is our company-wide digital transformation strategy. Our flat hierarchies enable short decision-making paths.

Excellence: We focus on what is really important, take responsibility, measure progress and work together in a spirit of trust. Together we rely on an agile way of working that encourages our employees to balance their private and work lives and to promote personal development.

Equity: We believe that different experiences are valuable, which is why every opinion is heard and valued. These experiences and opinions enrich the entire company. In this way, we promote a diverse and inclusive working environment in which colleagues in various Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) working groups such as, e.g. Engage Empowered Women, LGBT*IQ , DisAbility, X-Gen.

Joy: If we experience our work as meaningful, we get a lot in return. We achieve this by being proud of the contribution we make, appreciating each other and sharing this with joy and recognition. Our BRAVO Award program gives us an appreciative opportunity to do so. Our employees benefit from a comprehensive company health management "Pfizer in Balance" also during working hours.

Living our values extends well-beyond the workplace, you get the opportunity to support people in need and to carry out our efforts around diversity, inclusion & equity, environmental sustainability and against any form of exclusion through volunteering e.g., during our annual engagement days.

Visit our website for more Information at: Arbeiten bei Pfizer Deutschland

„Breakthroughs that change patients’ lives“ - Unser klares Unternehmensziel ist es, Durchbrüche zu erreichen, die das Leben von PatienInnen verändern. Sie sind der Sinn unseres Tuns. Wenn Sie Teil dieser Vision sein wollen und die gleiche Leidenschaft teilen, ist Pfizer der ideale Ort, um eine Karriere zu beginnen oder um eine erfolgreich fortzusetzen.

Überzeugt?

Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre Online-Bewerbung mit vollständigen und aussagekräftigen Unterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf und Dateien wie Zeugnisse u.ä. können Sie unter „Meine Berufserfahrung" unter Ihrem Lebenslauf hinzufügen und hochladen).

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen ausschließlich Bewerbungen über unsere Plattform annehmen können.

Pfizer garantiert Chancengleichheit während des gesamten Bewerbungsprozesses sowie die Einhaltung der lokalen Gesetzgebungen in den jeweiligen Ländern, in denen Pfizer agiert. Pfizer schließt jegliche diskriminierende Faktoren aus, die u. a. das Geschlecht und Alter, die ethnische Zugehörigkeit, Religion oder Weltanschauung, sexuelle Orientierung oder Behinderung betreffen.

Inklusion von Menschen mit Behinderungen

Unser Anliegen ist es, allen Mitarbeitenden zu ermöglichen, dass Sie ihre Fähigkeiten und Kenntnisse voll einbringen und weiterentwickeln können. Wir sind stolz darauf, ein inklusiver Arbeitgeber zu sein, indem wir allen Bewerber:innen gleiche Chancen bieten. Wir ermutigen Sie, sich von Ihrer besten Seite zu zeigen, mit dem Wissen und dem Vertrauen, dass wir alle angemessenen Anpassungen vornehmen werden, um Ihre Bewerbung und Ihre zukünftige Karriere zu unterstützen. Ihre Reise mit Pfizer beginnt hier!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Title: AI Engineer




Location : Remote in Germany (preferably Berlin)




Salary : 65k-100k +




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about AI and its transformative power in education we're reimagining education with AI.




Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you’ll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You’ll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.




Key Responsibilities:

Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of AI (doesn’t need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company’s success.
Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Title: Sports Scientist (m/f/x)
Description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and passionate individual who is committed to enhancing performance and wellbeing of our clients though data driven guidance. HAGIUS is pleased to offer an exceptional opportunity for a Sport Scientist (m/f/x) to join our dedicated team. With our small team, we provide a unique environment where every contribution is valued, yet our scale is sufficient to have a meaningful impact within the Wellness and Fitness industry.




The ideal candidate will possess a strong desire to assist our clients in achieving their fitness and wellness objectives. If you excel in a dynamic, supportive atmosphere and are keen on collaborating with a team equally committed to health and wellbeing, we invite you to apply.


Tasks



Working in and as part of a team of experts


Conducting personal training sessions and classes


Creating and performing physical assessments (using tools like force plates)


Assessing mental and emotional wellbeing


Analyzing assessment data and setting goals with clients


Creating training plans, schedules, recommendations based on data


Guiding clients through their journey at Hagius


Observing the progress made by clients


Gathering feedback from clients and trainers.


Fine-tune plans depending on progress and assessment data


Ensuring flow of information to the necessary team members



Requirements



Interest in the tasks above


Passion for data-driven fitness guidance


Ability to work as a team player in a team of experts


High-quality education in sports science (University Degree or comparable education)


at least one year work experience in the field of data driven training



Benefits



being part of a passionate team that's striving for honest training with high quality


free participation in classes and usage of facilities





We are looking forward to your application.

Title: Staff Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Data Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics. You will work within the Data Science Staff team.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments on a day to day basis
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other Data Science teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating large scale distributed machine learning trainings; 6+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also …


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


About Us

aignostics.com
Show more

You will work within the Data Science Staff team.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed

  • You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
  • You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
  • You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
  • You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments on a day to day basis
  • You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other Data Science teams involved in machine learning and translational research
  • You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
  • You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
  • You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
  • You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
  • You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
  • Educate mid-level and junior data scientists to bring them up to the next level
  • Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
  • Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code

What We Are Looking For

  • Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
  • Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
  • Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
  • Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
  • Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
  • Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
  • Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
  • Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating large scale distributed machine learning trainings; 6+ years of experience with this
  • Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
  • Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
  • Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
  • Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)

Ideally, you also …

  • Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
  • Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
  • Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
  • Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
  • Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
  • Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis

We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer

  • Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
  • Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
  • Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
  • Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
  • Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
  • Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
  • Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
  • Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
  • We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
  • Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
  • Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Applied Scientist
Description:
What You’ll Do


You’ll be responsible for extracting meaningful insights from large, imperfect datasets. Your work will turn raw data into actionable intelligence, improving the quality of our routing products.
You develop ML models that solve challenging problems, and lead the design, implementation, and integration of scalable AI/ML systems and services
Visualize and report on insights and trends (e.g. by building dashboards) in a structured way
Join a top-level international development team where your ideas and skills will contribute to leapfrogging competition when it comes to route quality, travel time estimation and/or electric vehicle battery consumption.
Dive into our products’ event streams and user sessions. Your expertise in data analysis will help decode complex datasets and transform them into valuable information that will help improve our products.
Generate and validate hypotheses around quality weak spots, assess the feasibility of implementing novel ideas in existing and/or “greenfield” code bases, and implement and ensure the idea ends up in our production code.
Guide more junior colleagues and contribute to team process improvements


What You’ll Need


You hold an M.Sc ., or PhD in Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or a relevant field. Your academic background has prepared you to tackle the complex challenges you’ll face in this role.
You possess advanced software skills and experience (3-7 years) in C++, Java and/or Python and your experience in developing production-grade code (incl. Infrastructure as Code) is matched by your ability to architect, implement, and maintain complex data processing systems (AWS or Azure).
You have relevant production experience with established tools and solutions (e.g. SQL, DataBricks, ML methods)
Experience in analyzing complex datasets and implementing models and algorithms, particularly with noisy real-time and historical data from connected devices as well as product event logs
Extensive experience in setting up and successfully conducting targeted experiments and R&D activities aligned with business objectives and customer needs.
You enjoy working in an international team and are a true team player. You understand that the best results come from collaboration and are eager to contribute to a collective effort.
Desire to learn, and expand your skill set
You have strong written and verbal communication abilities in English, enabling you to articulate complex technical concepts and collaborate effectively with team members.


What’s Nice To Have


Experience with DevOps practices will give you an edge.
Understanding the main quality aspects of routing and navigation experiences, as well as vehicle architecture, is a plus.
An interest in software architecture will help you contribute to the broader design and development efforts within the team.
Show more

Title: Applied Scientist
Description:
Are you ready to redefine the future of traffic and travel information?

We’re looking for an Applied Scientist to play a pivotal role in a greenfield project set to transform mobility for millions. This is more than just a job—it’s a chance to create something entirely new and reshape how people navigate their daily lives.

What You'll Do


Design and develop algorithms that extract actionable insights from massive, imperfect datasets, turning raw data into intelligence that powers the future of traffic technology.
Be a key contributor in an international development team, working collaboratively to conceptualize and build innovative travel information services.
Work with one of the largest traffic data streams worldwide, applying your expertise to decode complex datasets and improve mobility systems.
Lead the way in greenfield innovation, using your problem-solving skills to improve algorithms and build and optimize Java systems from scratch.
Take ownership of the full lifecycle of software projects, ensuring smooth transitions from research to production-level implementation.
Support and improve production environments to guarantee operational excellence of the systems you build.


What You'll Need


A Master’s or PhD in Research, Computer Science, or a relevant field.
3+ years of industry experience developing production-grade code, with proficiency in Java and Python.
Expertise in simplifying complex data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving.
Strong skills in Software Engineering, both in greenfield projects and optimizing existing systems.
Experience working with AWS or Azure, architecting and maintaining complex data processing systems.
You’re a collaborative team player who thrives in an international environment, and you have strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
While GIS and traffic engineering experience is a plus, your ability to simplify complexity and drive innovation is what we value most.


What’s Nice To Have


Familiarity with DevOps practices and cloud platforms like Azure.
An interest in software architecture to contribute to broader team goals.
Experience with greenfield innovation, building systems from scratch.


What We Offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work flexibility, where TomTom’ers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It’s all about getting the best out of both worlds – we ask TomTom’ers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.

Meet your team

We’re Maps, a global team within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for hundreds of millions of users around the world. Joining our team, you’ll continuously innovate our mapmaking processes, directly contributing to our vision engineering the world's most trusted and useful map.

At TomTom...

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.

After you apply

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs .

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about AI, data science, and building impactful solutions? Our client is an innovative AI startup based in Berlin, driving corporate sustainability forward. By leveraging AI, they help mid size companies streamline their ESG reporting, optimising processes and reducing costs. Using AI and machine learning, they collect relevant data to generate ESG reports more efficiently. Following a successful funding round and the release of their second version, they are now expanding their team and hiring a Data Scientist / Engineer, with plans for further growth in 2025.




What to expect:

You will lead the development of AI pipelines, focusing on RAG and LLMs. Your work will involve designing data pipelines, fine-tuning models, and ensuring real-time data feedback loops for improved accuracy. You will collaborate closely with the team to define AI-driven features that enhance the platform’s capabilities. This role is ideal for someone eager to work in a dynamic startup environment and make a real impact.




Requirements:

2+ years experience in Data Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering
Experienced in LLMs and RAG models
Expertise in data collection, processing, and pipeline development
Proficient in Python for AI and machine learning applications
Experience in AI observability, evaluation metrics and Azure AI is a plus




Perks:

Flexible work
Equity
Real Impact
Collaborative Working
Show more

Title: Research Sciences Intern (VISION)
Description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

The Applied Sciences Group (ASG) is seeking a highly motivated and talented PhD student to join our team as a Research Intern. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge research in the fields of Large Language Models (LLMs), Vision-Language Models (VLMs), and Generative Image & Video. The successful candidate will collaborate with a team of experienced researchers and engineers to tackle real-world challenges and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies.

Responsibilities


Conduct research in one or more of the following areas: LLMs, VLMs, and Generative Image & Video.
Design and implement experiments to test new hypotheses and validate research findings.
Develop and optimise algorithms and models for various AI applications.
Collaborate with team members to integrate research outcomes into practical solutions.
Present research findings to the team and contribute to publications and patents.


Qualifications

Required: Qualifications:


Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong background in LLMs, VLMs, or Generative Image & Video.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex ideas clearly.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong track record of success, evidenced by publications in prestigious computer vision and machine learning conferences, including NeurIPS, ECCV, ICCV, CVPR.
Proven software engineering capabilities, evidenced by professional experience, internships, impactful open-source contributions, and success in coding competitions.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
Show more
