Title: AI Development Specialist
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write German for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders that also speak German to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in German (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.
Show more

Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in German (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

We are seeking an AI Agent Engineer to join our team at Naptha AI, where you'll help build and test AI agents using our interoperability platform. This role is perfect for developers who are passionate about AI and eager to gain hands-on experience with the latest agent frameworks and large language models.

Core Responsibilities


Build and deploy AI agents using various frameworks
Test agent interactions and document behavior
Help improve agent performance and reliability
Assist with agent integration and testing
Contribute to our growing agent ecosystem

Strong Python programming skills
Experience working with LLMs (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.)

Open source contributions

Final discussion


Compensation & Benefits


Competitive salary and equity
Remote-first work environment
Full medical coverage
Flexible PTO
Learning budget


Join us in building the future of AI agent interoperability! This is an excellent opportunity to grow your skills in a rapidly evolving field.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Protect AI

Protect AI is shaping, defining, and innovating a new category within cybersecurity around the risk and security of AI/ML. Our ML Security Platform enables customers to see, know, and manage security risks to defend against unique AI security threats, and embrace MLSecOps for a safer AI-powered world. This includes a broad set of capabilities including AI supply chain security, Auditable Bill of Materials for AI, ML model scanning, signing, attestation and LLM Security.

Join our team to help us solve this critical need of protecting AI!

Role

Protect AI is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team in Berlin. Our engineering team builds and operates ‘Protect AI Platform’ covering everything from AI supply chain security and ML Model Scanning to LLM Security. You will work closely with fellow Software Engineers who bring a variety of skillset to the table including Backend, Frontend, Infra, ML and Security Engineering. You will also get opportunity to work closely with Product Managers, Architects and our CTO.

Responsibilities


Build and operate a Machine Learning platform
Design and develop the platform that will enable innovation, delivery, and operation of ML and AI models throughout Protect AI
Collaborate across functions (Product Managers, Engineers, and Researchers) to understand requirements and develop solutions
Act as a technical leader and mentor junior team members
Continuously improve the software development process, including testing, deployment, and monitoring


Qualifications


Significant experience (4+ years) building and maintaining Machine Learning platforms on Cloud and Kubernetes based infrastructure.
Significant experience working with containers and Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, and MLOps best practices.
Significant expertise in IaC tools (Terraform).
Expertise in modern Python (type hints, Pydantic, ..) and at least one strongly typed programming language (Go, Java, C#, C++).
Exposure to ML related tools such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Pandas, Polars, Scikit Learn, and Jupyter.
Exposure to ML research and engineering teams developing, deploying, and operating models.
Strong communication and problem solving skills.
Excited about working in an agile and fast paced environment.


What We Offer


An exciting, collaborative work environment in a fast-growing startup.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development including attending and presenting technical talks at meetups and conferences.
A culture that values innovation, accountability, and teamwork.
Opportunities to contribute to our open source projects with thousands of Github stars.
Work with a team of talented and well-accomplished peers from AWS, Microsoft and Oracle Cloud.
Work with best in class tools — M2 Macbook Pro, 34” Monitor, modern tech stack and high quality collaboration tools.
No bureaucracy and legacy systems. You are empowered to innovate and do your best work.


Protect AI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (d/f/m) - Large-scale Machine Learning
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That’s where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Data Scientist in Aignostic's foundation model team you will work on our self-supervised base models. Together with collaborators in academia and industry you will push the state of the art in large-scale machine learning for digital pathology. Within our team of experts on large-scale machine learning and data handling, you will work on improving, benchmarking and extending our family of best-in-class foundations models, bridging image, text and other pathology data modalities. Moreover, using our foundation models you will contribute to developing prototypes for new applications to assist pathologists and generate new insights for improving cancer treatment.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Research, pilot and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Support and mentor junior colleagues
Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations


What We Are Looking For


Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and several years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
Experience with developing large-scale self-supervised deep learning models ("Foundation Models") for vision or language applications
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
Excellent communication and team working skills


Bonus points for


Exposure to biomedical data
Leadership experience in a research context
Hands-on experience with developing and integrating Vision Language Models (VLMs)
Experience in considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you’ll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

aignostics.com
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
A company just West of Berlin are seeking a dedicated Senior Python Developer to join their dynamic team.




As a Senior developer, you will guide the cross-functional team, ensuring an agile working style and the adoption of best practices.




You will develop and implement a range of software solutions, contributing to the continuous improvement and stability of their platform using a tech stack that includes Python and TypeScript or React.




Responsibilities

Promote continuous improvement and high-quality software delivery, including effective impediment management.
Develop and maintain key components of our platform, ensuring continuous improvements and operational stability in the user space.
Use Python and/or TypeScript & React to develop robust applications.




Your Profile

A bachelor's degree (higher degrees preferred) in STEM, engineering, or a related field.
Experience as a software developer (3+ years).
Strong understanding of agile principles, values, and practices.
Proficiency in their tech stack, particularly Python and/or TypeScript and their ecosystems.
Proficiency in German (C1 level) is required; English (C1 level) is an advantage.




Why Join this company?

Exciting and diverse tasks with close collaboration in small teams.
A flat hierarchy with open communication channels and direct access to leadership.
Flexible working hours and the option to work from home.
Competitive salary and dedicated time for continuous improvement.




Join this scaling tech company who specialize in artificial intelligence, and programming, to work on innovative solutions in mobility, energy, and AI, and to be part of a team that values self-organization, creativity, and a fun, challenging work environment.




Please apply or send your CV to j.oniah@annapurnarecruitment.com.

Title: Optimization Research Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
DEINE AUFGABEN


Develop state-of-the-art optimization solvers for the steel industry
Understand and analyse the complex business logic, constraints and objectives of our customers
Translate the business logic into high-performance algorithms and mathematical optimization models
Validate the performance and quality of your models by proper test- and benchmarks sets
Manage and maintain the embedded role of the solver in a broader, modern backend architecture
Explain and document your approaches and ideas to the team


DEIN PROFIL


Experience in developing solutions for difficult combinatorial optimization problems from the industry
Strong background in Mixed-Integer Programming (MIP), Linear Programming (LP) and combinatorial optimization algorithms
Ability to build MIP models for real-world problems
Experience in using optimization solving software like: Gurobi, Xpress, SCIP, HiGHS, CBC ...
Strong C++ background (preferably C++20 or higher)
Ability to explain complex concepts to your team
Experience working in agile environments, containers and CI/CD concepts
English is required, Fluency in German is a plus


Benefits


Transparency of business strategies
Working in our Berlin Office (incl. 2 Home Office days/week)
Autonomy balanced by responsibility
Cohesive, multidisciplinary team
Meaningful industrial problems
Modern machine learning techniques
Sleek, new office located in Berlin
Professional educational opportunities
German language courses and public transport included


Über uns

Smart Steel Technologies liefert gebrauchsfertige Softwareprodukte mit künstlicher Intelligenz für die Prozessoptimierung in Stahlwerken, die zu einer verbesserten Qualität, einer Senkung der Energiekosten und einer Verbesserung der Kosten und CO2-Effizienz führen. Dazu verwenden wir aktuelle Methoden wie Mixed-Integer-Optimierung klassicher empirischer Modelle, Data Science und grundlegende Statistik und Prognose auf einer modernen Software Architektur.

Übrigens: Wusstest du schon, dass Stahl das weltweit am meisten recycelte Material ist? Unser Team ist der entscheidende Erfolgsfaktor. Möchtest Du mit uns wachsen? Dann suchen wir Dich!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Free lunch 2 days per week
Pension plan contributions
Public transportation subsidies
Bike leasing program
Monthly social events, massages, Thursday happy hours, sports teams
An awesome office in Friedrichshain, Berlin


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:


  • Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
  • Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
  • Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
  • Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
  • Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices


Please apply if you have:


  • Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
  • Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
  • Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
  • Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
  • Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
  • Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
  • Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
  • Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
  • Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models


Benefits:


  • Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
  • Focus on mental health and well-being:
    • Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
    • Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
    • Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
    • No meeting Fridays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
  • Paid volunteer time
  • Focus on your career growth:
    • Development Dollars
    • Leadership development
    • Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
  • Travel Discounts
  • Employee Resource Groups
  • 6 weeks paid vacation
  • Free lunch 2 days per week
  • Pension plan contributions
  • Public transportation subsidies
  • Bike leasing program
  • Monthly social events, massages, Thursday happy hours, sports teams
  • An awesome office in Friedrichshain, Berlin

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: (Senior) Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Engineer (all genders)
Company: MSG Food ام اس جي الغذائية
Description:
Berlin
Vollzeit
unbefristet


Teile diesen Job!

Jetzt bewerben!

Spannende IT-Projekte, attraktive Karrierechancen, Kontinuität, Sicherheit und Nachhaltigkeit – das alles findest du bei uns. Denn als unabhängige international agierende Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 10.000 Mitarbeitenden sind wir in vielen dynamischen Märkten aktiv und unterstützen unsere Kunden als starker Partner bei der digitalen Transformation.

Wir entwickeln im Geschäftsbereich msg.AI innovative Kundenlösungen in den Bereichen Artificial Intelligence und Data Science, um unseren Kunden in spannenden IT-Projekten technisch sowie fachlich zur Seite zu stehen. Hier stehen besonders die Entwicklung kompletter LLM basierter Lösungen und die Beratung zu Gen AI wie auch Machine-Learning im Fokus. Werde Teil unserer msg-Kultur!

Das erwartet dich bei uns


Gestaltung und Umsetzung innovativer Digitalisierungsprojekte im übergreifenden KI-Bereich msg.AI von der Idee bis zum Betrieb
Identifikation von Anwendungsfällen & Integration von KI-Technologien (v.a. LLM, NLP und Machine Learning) als Enabler für diverse Branchen
Verantwortung für die technische Implementierung von KI-Modellen und ML-Algorithmen in einem interdisziplinären Team
Unterstützung bei der Definition von KPIs und Ergebnismetriken zur Evaluation von Algorithmen
Anwendung von Best Practices im Bereich KI-Engineering und ML-Operations
Evaluierung neuer Technologien und Tools
Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von Qualitätsstandards und Best Practices in der KI-Entwicklung


Das bringst du mit


Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik, Machine Learning, Business Analytics, Data Science, Robotik, Informationstechnologie oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in Python, Git und einschlägigen ML-Bibliotheken und Frameworks
Erfahrung mit Tools zur Datenvisualisierung (z.B. Seaborn, Matplotlib, Plotly)
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen (z. B. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Von uns für dich – deine Benefits

Gelebte Kultur "Mensch im Mittelpunkt"

Nachhaltige Projekte & Soziales Engagement

Förderung von Diversität & Chancengleichheit

Vertrauensvoller Teamspirit & Gestaltungsfreiheit

Passgenaue Weiterentwicklung & Mentoring

Flexibles Arbeiten & Work-Life Integration

Corporate Benefits

Mobiles Arbeiten

Deine Ansprechperson Bei Rückfragen

Alexandra Wilfersegger

HR Specialist

recruiting@msg.group

… und begrüßen alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Herkunft, Behinderung, Nationalität, Religion, Alter, Geschlecht sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. Vielfalt macht uns als Team stark – werde ein Teil davon!

Title: AI-Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Du möchtest die Zukunft der Künstlichen Intelligenz mitgestalten und innovative AI-Lösungen für FUNKE Digital entwickeln? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams am Standort Berlin als

AI-Engineer (m/w/d)

DEINE AUFGABEN


Du kümmerst Dich eigenständig um die Konzeption, Entwicklung und Optimierung von AI-Agenten, die Geschäftsprozesse automatisieren und intelligente Entscheidungen treffen
Du übernimmst die Integration von LLMs in Agenten-Architekturen zur Optimierung interner Workflows und digitaler Produkte
Die Nutzung der Google Cloud Plattform zur Skalierung und Bereitstellung von AI-Anwendungen liegt in Deinen Händen
Du arbeitest eng mit dem Data Engineering Team und der KI-Task Force zusammen und kümmerst Dich hauptverantwortlich um die Integration von KI-Funktionen in bestehende Systeme
Zu Deinem Aufgabenbereich gehört die Analyse von Datensätzen zur Identifizierung von Mustern und zur Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Die Evaluierung neuer KI-Technologien und Methoden zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung unserer AI-Lösungen runden Deinen Aufgabenbereich ab



DEIN PROFIL


Du kannst auf ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Data Science, Künstlicher Intelligenz oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet zurückblicken
Du bringst mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Implementierung von KI-Lösungen mit, idealerweise mit Fokus auf LLMs und generativer KI
Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse in Python sowie Erfahrung mit LangChain, OpenAI API, Gemini und anderen relevanten AI-Frameworks
Du hast Erfahrung mit agentenbasierten Systemen und der Entwicklung komplexer Workflows
Außerdem hast Du Erfahrung mit der Google Cloud Plattform (Vertex AI, BigQuery, Cloud Functions) zur Bereitstellung von AI-Anwendungen
Dich zeichnen starke analytische & problemlösende Fähigkeiten, effektive Kommunikation und Zusammenarbeit in interdisziplinären Teams aus



Deine Benefits


Top ausgestattet: In unserer zentral gelegenen Location in der Friedrichstraße erwartet Dich ein moderner voll ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz
Entwickle Dich mit uns: Wir ermöglichen Dir die Teilnahme an individuellen Coachings, Workshops oder (Online)-Trainings im Rahmen unserer FUNKE Akademie
Flexibel arbeiten: Wir leben ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell, weil uns Deine Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist
Teamwork: Dich erwarten ein dynamisches cross-funktionales Team, eine offene Feedbackkultur, kurze Kommunikationswege und ein herzliches Miteinander
Corporate Benefits: Wir bieten Dir ein Benefit-Portal mit attraktiven Rabatten und Abos
Halte Dich fit und gesund: Profitiere von unseren Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und lasse Dich für Deine mentale und körperliche Gesundheit individuell beraten



Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann gestalte mit uns die Zukunft und sende uns Deine Bewerbung an Daniela Naskret-Adomat.

Title: Python Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission


Als Python Backend Developer (m/w/d) bei SIDES sind Sie verantwortlich für das Design, die Implementierung und die Wartung von Backend-Systemen und APIs mit Python. Ihre Expertise in FastAPI und SQLAlchemy wird entscheidend sein, um skalierbare und leistungsstarke Anwendungen zu entwickeln, die ein nahtloses Benutzererlebnis bieten. Sie werden eng mit unseren Frontend Entwicklern, Data Scientists und anderen Teammitgliedern zusammenarbeiten, um robuste und effiziente Lösungen bereitzustellen!


Hauptaufgaben:



Design, Entwicklung und Wartung von Backend-Diensten und APIs mit Python


Zusammenarbeit mit Frontend-Entwicklern zur Integration von Benutzeroberflächenelementen mit serverseitiger Logik


Sicherstellung der Leistung, Qualität und Reaktionsfähigkeit der Anwendungen


Implementierung von Sicherheits- und Datenschutzprotokollen


Schreiben von sauberem, wartbarem und gut dokumentiertem Code


Durchführung von Code-Reviews und konstruktives Feedback an Teammitglieder


Fehlerbehebung und Debugging von Anwendungen zur Sicherstellung optimaler Leistung


Auf dem neuesten Stand der Branchentrends, Technologien und Best Practices bleiben


Teilnahme an agilen Entwicklungsprozessen, einschließlich Sprint-Planung, Daily Stand-ups und Retrospektiven



Your profile
Erforderliche Fähigkeiten und Qualifikationen:



Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einem verwandten Bereich oder gleichwertige Berufserfahrung


Nachgewiesene Erfahrung als Python-Entwickler, insbesondere in der Backend-Entwicklung (5+ Jahre)


Starke Kenntnisse der Programmiersprache Python.Erfahrung mit Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL, MySQL, REDIS, DynamoB)


Vertrautheit mit RESTful APIs und Webservices


Verständnis für asynchrone Programmierung und ereignisgesteuerte Architektur


Kenntnisse in Containerisierung und Bereitstellung mit Docker


Erfahrung mit Versionskontrollsystemen, insbesondere Git


Ausgeprägte Problemlösungsfähigkeiten sowie die Fähigkeit, sowohl eigenständig als auch im Team zu arbeiten


Hervorragende Kommunikations- und Kollaborationsfähigkeiten


Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil, um effektiv mit unserem deutschsprachigen Team und unseren Kunden zu kommunizieren



Bevorzugte Fähigkeiten:



Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud


Erfahrung mit FastAPI, SQLAlchemy und ORM


Vertrautheit mit CI/CD-Pipelines und Tools wie Jenkins, Travis CI oder GitLab CI


Kenntnisse in Frontend-Technologien wie JavaScript, HTML und CSS


Erfahrung mit dem Schreiben von Unit-Tests


Erfahrung mit JIRA


Vertrautheit mit Microservices-Architektur und serverlosem Computing



Perks & Benefits
Was du von uns erwarten kannst:



A recipe for success: Wir sind dieses Jahr 10 Jahre alt geworden und sind als Spezialisten in der Gastronomie/Lieferindustrie bekannt. Mit SIDES repräsentierst du einen führenden Akteur auf diesem Gebiet.


Add ownership: Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, dein Talent und deine Ideen zu formen. Du hast Freiheit und Verantwortung in deiner täglichen Arbeit innerhalb deines Teams.


High-quality work equipment: Du erhältst erstklassige Ausrüstung, um deine Arbeit erfolgreich auszuführen. Im Büro erwarten dich moderne Geräte und ausreichend Platz für angenehme Interaktionen mit dem SIDES-Team.


Hungry for growth: Persönliches Wachstum und kontinuierliches Lernen haben bei uns oberste Priorität. Wir führen regelmäßige Feedback-Zyklen durch, bieten dir Möglichkeiten zur Teilnahme an Seminaren, Workshops und Kongressen.


Perks:



Firmenrabatte (CorporateBenefits), Zugang zu mehreren Mitarbeiterrabatten


Rabatt auf eine Fitnessstudio-Mitgliedschaft


E-Learning-Möglichkeiten


Mental Health-App-Einrichtung: InstaHelp


Snacks und Getränke im Büro






Baking a positive workplace: Dich erwartet ein fantastisches, perfekt vernetztes Büro im Herzen von Berlin (Schöneberg).
Klingt genau nach dem, was du gesucht hast? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestem Eintrittstermin.

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d) Machine Learning Ops
Description:
As a Machine Learning Operation Engineer (ML OPS) you are part of our ED&AA Unit at Siemens Energy and work on challenging projects from all areas of the energy industry. You will transform Machine Learning models to well-engineered products fulfilling development, deployment and monitoring requirements and standards.

Let’s Talk About You!

What You Bring


Hands-on experience with ML frameworks, libraries, agile environments and deploying machine learning solutions using DevOps principles.
Excellent knowledge of data science programming languages (Python, R, Scala).
Excellent knowledge of the boto3 AWS SDK or additional SDKs for other cloud platforms.
Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure.
Excellent knowledge of container technologies (docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift etc.).
Familiar with REST API protocol as well as at least model serving technologies (MLFlow, Seldon Core, Kubeflow, TFX, Sagemaker endpoints etc.).
Excellent knowledge of the ML life-cycle.
Experience in creation of CI/CD pipelines for machine learning projects.



How You Will Make An Impact


Deploy, operationalize and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models with a focus on optimization of model hyperparameters, automated retraining and model training, version control and governance and model monitoring and its drift.
Establish model onboarding, operations, and decommissioning workflows.
Track, snapshot & manage assets used to create the models.
Enable collaboration, sharing and standardization of ML pipelines developed by data scientists.
Maintain model asset integrity & persist access control logs.
Certify model behavior meets regulatory & adversarial standards. You will be heavily supported by data scientists and Subject Matter Experts in this task
Support model portability across a variety of platforms. We do not have cloud-agnostic ML pipelines, but dependencies should be minimal.
Certify model performance meets functional and latency requirements.
Evaluate design patterns for model deployment. Evaluate design patterns for unit testing and integration testing for machine learning products.
Create and maintain scalable ML Ops frameworks to support product-specific models.



Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With ~100,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits


An inclusive team culture where you can be yourself
Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
Welfare: flexible welfare programs and health insurance.



https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs

As a Machine Learning Operation Engineer (ML OPS) you are part of our ED&AA Unit at Siemens Energy and work on challenging projects from all areas of the energy industry. You will transform Machine Learning models to well-engineered products fulfilling development, deployment and monitoring requirements and standards.

Let’s Talk About You!

What You Bring

  • Hands-on experience with ML frameworks, libraries, agile environments and deploying machine learning solutions using DevOps principles.
  • Excellent knowledge of data science programming languages (Python, R, Scala).
  • Excellent knowledge of the boto3 AWS SDK or additional SDKs for other cloud platforms.
  • Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure.
  • Excellent knowledge of container technologies (docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift etc.).
  • Familiar with REST API protocol as well as at least model serving technologies (MLFlow, Seldon Core, Kubeflow, TFX, Sagemaker endpoints etc.).
  • Excellent knowledge of the ML life-cycle.
  • Experience in creation of CI/CD pipelines for machine learning projects.


How You Will Make An Impact

  • Deploy, operationalize and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models with a focus on optimization of model hyperparameters, automated retraining and model training, version control and governance and model monitoring and its drift.
  • Establish model onboarding, operations, and decommissioning workflows.

  • Evaluate design patterns for model deployment. Evaluate design patterns for unit testing and integration testing for machine learning products.
  • Create and maintain scalable ML Ops frameworks to support product-specific models.

Title: AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you a passionate AI/ML Engineer looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our team and be at the forefront of AI-driven transformation!

About The Team

Data is the fuel that keeps our world moving, and we at Natuvion are experts in moving large quantities of it. We are a small team of computer science experts dedicated to accelerating data transformation, making it more efficient, pleasant, and secure. Essentially, we operate as a startup within a well-established company. Our team members hold advanced degrees in computer engineering, logic, physics, and related fields, fostering a culture of deep technical expertise and continuous learning. We pride ourselves on our fast-paced development, strong team culture, and open, focused communication.

Why Join Us?


Innovative Projects: Work on designing and implementing fascinating projects like implementing a programming language in conjunction with cutting-edge AI applications.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values open communication and collaboration, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Engage with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to real-world problems.
Professional Growth: Benefit from a culture that encourages continuous learning and professional development.



Your Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms to solve complex problems and enhance our products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Conduct data preprocessing and feature engineering to prepare data for modeling.
Implement and optimize AI techniques such as semantic search, NLP, and recommendation systems.
Ensure code quality and scalability through the use of typing tools like mypy and pyright.
Generate comprehensive documentation and presentations to communicate findings and solutions.
Analyze current AI scenarios, identify gaps, and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning to continuously improve our solutions.



Job requirements

Core Skills


Deep Learning and Machine Learning: Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Understanding of current models and their applications.
AI Techniques and Applications: Experience with various AI techniques such as semantic search, natural language processing (NLP), and recommendation systems.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a strong emphasis on scalable and understandable code using typing tools like mypy and pyright. Familiarity with Haskell is a plus.
Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering: Expertise in preparing and transforming raw data into suitable formats for modeling.
Documentation and Presentation: Ability to generate comprehensive documentation and presentations.
Collaboration and Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively within the team and with other stakeholders.
Analyzing AI Scenarios: Ability to analyze the current basis for specific AI scenarios like Automatic Data Analysis, Root Cause Identification, Mapping Rule Generation, and other relevant areas for large scale data transformations. Identify gaps and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.



About Our Core Products


DCS (Data Conversion Server): An orchestration engine for designing, executing, and monitoring data transformation workflows within SAP systems.
Compose: A programming language for DCS that enables bidirectional compilation, allowing DCS content to be converted into Compose code and vice versa, facilitating version control, continuous integration, and more.



What You Can Expect From Us

An environment that is always open to change and optimization. There is no such thing as “that's the way it's always been” with us. You have the chance to contribute your knowledge, shape processes, standardize existing topics or optimize workflows. Be a driving force and take us even further with your expertise!

We Create An Environment In Which You Feel Comfortable


Home office contracts
Permanent employment and 30 days' vacation
Trust-based working hours - work in a way that best suits your everyday life and our customers
Mentoring program - a good induction according to your needs for an optimal start with us
#teamgreen - An internal network of experienced experts for mutual exchange and the joint development of solutions to problems
An appreciative employee culture, flat hierarchies, short communication channels and an open-door policy - a team that supports and inspires each other!
Regular team events and workshops on site
With our new health benefit 'Nilo' you get 10 free therapy sessions a year and can use the app for meditations, lessons and courses - all for your well-being!
Further training is a priority



Join #teamgreen - Natuvion is a digital moving company.

Our team doesn't move desks, filing cabinets or chairs. Natuvion moves business-critical data and processes from one technology platform to another. Typical Natuvion “relocation services” include data migration, data transformation, data integration, data protection, data security and data quality.

Our >400 consultants and developers in Germany, Austria, Slovakia, the USA and Australia have extensive expertise in (SAP®) projects and a profound understanding of processes across industry boundaries. With a great deal of experience, commitment and dedication, they support our customers with consulting, services and our own software technology. In this way, we enable companies to use their data and processes on the most modern and innovative platforms at all times.

Join us and be a part of a team that is at the forefront of AI innovation, driving transformation and delivering value to our clients and partners. If you are passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we would love to hear from you
Show more

Title: AI Engineer (m/f/d) in B2B SaaS AI Startup
Description:
We are traide AI 🤖, a groundbreaking deep tech, VC-backed, B2B startup powered by AI ( we did AI long before the hype 😉😁) .




Our breakthrough in revenue, with an increase of over 10x in the past year, positions us at the brink of a significant expansion phase🔥. By developing the definitive "global trade compliance intelligence platform", building up around our customs classification engine, fully powered by (artifical-) Intelligence, we’re already transforming the landscape of international trade.




Our product, team, and vision have convinced already prestigious partners like PwC, and our customer base includes industry juggernauts such as Siemens, every day industry Heros like Würth, alongside other notable figures in industry. We are rapidly solidifying our leadership position within the EU while eyeing global expansion 🏆.




AI is deeply embedded in the DNA of our company, reflected in the extensive AI expertise of our founders, the culture within our company and team, and our proven track record of developing and commercializing AI while delivering real business value with AI-centered features 🤖 🧬 . This role aims to strengthen our AI DNA, enabling us to further execute our vision and mission🚀 .




If you are an exceptional individual and feel that you would be a great fit for our compact yet highly skilled team, let us know about you. We would be delighted to hear from you 🤝💡 !


Tasks


As an AI Engineer, you’ll collaborate closely with our product and tech team to develop innovative features that address customer needs and drive business impact. In this role, you'll engage in:





Research & Experimentation: Research and delve into cutting-edge AI techniques, prototype novel ideas, and rigorously validate concepts through experiments and metrics.


End-to-End Development: Transform research insights into production-ready features through careful planning, prototype development, quality assurance, and seamless integration of AI functionalities.


Problem Solving & Innovation: With a curious and analytical mindset, you’ll ask the deeper “why” questions to uncover root problems, explore creative solutions, and bring them to life.


Take a product-focused approach and care about building solutions that are robust, scalable, and easy to use.





While you’ll take on significant responsibility, you’re never alone. You can rely on a supportive team where knowledge-sharing and mutual growth are core values.


Requirements



Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in: Data-Sience, Machine learning, Deeplearning and/or Generative AI & AI-Agents. With a proven track record of developing and deploying AI-driven solutions in production environments.


Strong Software-Engineering OR Data-Science background. Have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or comparable experience.


Strong analytical, logical reasoning, skills with a creative approach to problem-solving.


Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.


Communication skills, collaborative attitude and ability to work effectively within a diverse team.





Experience with some of these technologies:
- Programming Language: Python (required); Deeplearning Frameworks: pytorch, tensorflow, Other: ML-Ops


Benefits


So, why choose traide AI?




On the product side





Meetings and processes kept to a minimum and focus on getting things done (Kanban Style).


We value clean and well-tested code and ship features only once they are up to standard


Modern tech stack with the opportunity to shape future decisions: React + Chakra-UI, Node.js + GraphQL, Python + Pytorch, LLM/Generative AI and more





In the organization




✔️ traide AI is a place where you can be your authentic self!




✔️ We are creators, not rule followers. In our open culture, ideas take precedence over hierarchies, truth finding is essential 🙌




✔️ Our work culture is flexible and grounded entirely in trust and integrity, where everyone strives to grow & learn




✔️ And the cherry on top? Our offices are the coolest around – our cozy Berlin office is conveniently located at Rosenthaler Platz and offers fantastic lunch spots.




We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you better 🚀




If you have any questions, just email us.

Title: Sports Scientist (m/f/x)
Description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and passionate individual who is committed to enhancing performance and wellbeing of our clients though data driven guidance. HAGIUS is pleased to offer an exceptional opportunity for a Sport Scientist (m/f/x) to join our dedicated team. With our small team, we provide a unique environment where every contribution is valued, yet our scale is sufficient to have a meaningful impact within the Wellness and Fitness industry.




The ideal candidate will possess a strong desire to assist our clients in achieving their fitness and wellness objectives. If you excel in a dynamic, supportive atmosphere and are keen on collaborating with a team equally committed to health and wellbeing, we invite you to apply.


Tasks



Working in and as part of a team of experts


Conducting personal training sessions and classes


Creating and performing physical assessments (using tools like force plates)


Assessing mental and emotional wellbeing


Analyzing assessment data and setting goals with clients


Creating training plans, schedules, recommendations based on data


Guiding clients through their journey at Hagius


Observing the progress made by clients


Gathering feedback from clients and trainers.


Fine-tune plans depending on progress and assessment data


Ensuring flow of information to the necessary team members



Requirements



Interest in the tasks above


Passion for data-driven fitness guidance


Ability to work as a team player in a team of experts


High-quality education in sports science (University Degree or comparable education)


at least one year work experience in the field of data driven training



Benefits



being part of a passionate team that's striving for honest training with high quality


free participation in classes and usage of facilities





We are looking forward to your application.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior ML Engineer

Location: Berlin / Hybrid (2 days on-site)

Salary: €95k - €110k




WHO’S THIS WITH?




Very successful, respected and leading fashion and lifestyle on-line retailer, a Berlin success story in itself.
You will be joining as a senior engineering member in a team looking to integrate Machine Learning into what they are currently working across




WHAT’S THE ROLE?




Senior Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in image generation and computer vision
Being the lead in ML engineering to enable the building of future shaping content production tooling




WHAT DO I NEED TO BE GOOD AT?




Assessing various different solutions, tools or AI models
InnovatIng, consultanting, developing and making decisions on integrating the right AI solutions into the existing infrastructure
ETL pipelines, AWS Sagemaker, Bedrock and general ML/AI experience
Technical Leadership




WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?




Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong software engineering skills with Python and ideally one other language like Kotlin or Java
3D representation, PyTorch, Keras, and TensorFlow




BENEFITS, PERKS, BONUSES




Wide range of benefits including large on-line discounts, shares programme, working abroad allowance, family, health and well-being services and many many more.
You will be joining a company where a vision of sustainability, diversity, inclusion and community is a continuing key part of the culture




Extra.

This is a hybrid role, based in Berlin (top location) with an expectance to ideally be on-site / in office for 2 days a week.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Title: AI Engineer




Location : Remote in Germany (preferably Berlin)




Salary : 65k-100k +




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about AI and its transformative power in education we're reimagining education with AI.




Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you’ll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You’ll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.




Key Responsibilities:

Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of AI (doesn’t need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company’s success.
Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you’ll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You’ll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
  • Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
  • Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
  • Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.


Must-Have Skills:

  • Strong understanding of AI (doesn’t need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
  • Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
  • Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
  • A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
  • Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.


Nice-to-Have Skills:

  • Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
  • Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.


What We Offer:

  • Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company’s success.
  • Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
  • Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Title: Backend Engineer for Machine Learning
Description:
✨ About Us ✨

Photoroom was launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our mission is clear: to create the best visuals for your commerce.

Photoroom puts the power of great images into more people's hands through our powerful and innovative features, from our best-in-the-world background remover to our generative AI model and tools: AI Images, AI Backgrounds and Shadows, AI Expand, and many more.

Processing over 5 billion images a year and downloaded over 200 million times, Photoroom is now the world's #1 AI photo-editing app, available across mobile, web, and via an API in over 180 countries.

We are at an exciting stage of our journey. Having successfully raised our Series B, we aim at sustaining 40% YoY growth.

Photoroom is a profitable, remote-friendly company headquartered in Paris with a global team of over 80 world-class deep learning, product, and marketing experts with backgrounds at the world's best companies. We are a diverse team of entrepreneurs building for entrepreneurs.

TL;DR

🤓 We are looking for a FastAPI developer, expert in async Python to help us add new AI features in Photoroom. You will build and enhance AI features, improve private API speed, and integrate multiple services to deliver high-quality images to our users

💰 €70k to €90k* + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 Flexible location: you can work remotely from anywhere in Europe with monthly visits to Paris (fully reimbursed), or come to the office more often

✈️ If needed, relocation support (up to 10k€), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure. Notice: We are currently unable to sponsor visas for remote positions outside of France.

🏖️ Socials - Biannual company retreats, monthly gatherings


We can go higher for outstanding profiles and adapt to the cost of living if it is higher than in Paris.


✨ About the role ✨


You’ll collaborate with the AI Tools squad implement and improve AI features in the Photoroom app (Logo maker, AI Images and other features available on the homepage of the app)
You’ll design and architect new features, chaining a mix of internal and external services to generate breathtaking images for our users
You’ll monitor and scale the growing load on the FastAPI service, leveraging Datadog to find optimizations and bottlenecks or implementing smart caching of pipeline steps


✨ About You ✨


You have experience designing and updating internal REST APIs, collaborating with other teams to gather their requirements and monitoring and improving the performance of existing services, ideally with Datadog.
You have work experience with FastAPI or a similar async Python http framework (has to be async).
You have experience with integration testing in a large Python project and wiring multiple external services or APIs together reliably
You have worked in a fast-paced startup in the past
Bonus: You have experience with image libraries in Python (Pillow, OpenCV)
Bonus: you have worked with Server Side Events


If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

🌈 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. We believe both the company and its culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's why:


We have flexible working hours
We trust people to work remotely
We extended the length of the parental leave


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Title: Staff Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Data Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics. You will work within the Data Science Staff team.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments on a day to day basis
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other Data Science teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating large scale distributed machine learning trainings; 6+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also …


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


About Us

  • Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
  • Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
  • Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
  • Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
  • Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
  • Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
  • Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year

Title: Senior Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That’s where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Aignostics, you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. You translate biomedical challenges into concrete machine learning research roadmaps and coordinate their execution. Together with your colleagues you develop elegant solutions to complex problems, conduct rigorous experiments and finally convince your stakeholders with crystal clear presentations.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Research, pilot and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Support and mentor junior colleagues
Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations


What We Are Looking For


Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and several years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
Excellent communication and team working skills Bonus points for
Experience with development of deep learning models for computer vision
Exposure to biomedical data
Leadership experience in a research context


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development budget, language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you’ll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!
